loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 28 year old man who lives with his wife in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon. Khoder has been selling fruit and vegetables since 2005. He sells tomatoes, watermelon, cucumbers, green beans and other produce. His produce changes from season to season. He sells from his van and goes from shop to shop throughout his entire region. 
He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a new van for work because his current one is very old and needs a lot of maintenance. This maintenance will cost more than buying another van. This is the first time that Khoder has requested a loan.
Khoder is well known for the good quality of the produce he sells. His clients are people from his region. When he first started he had to face competition as there are a lot of other producers who also sell in his region. Khoder decided to start his business because of his experience. In the future he plans to keep expanding his business by growing more produce and selling it in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To buy a new van for his business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 49 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ibrahim has been working as a car painter since 2003. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is the fourth cycle and he has always paid on time.

Ibrahimi is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does a good job. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had some financial difficulties in order to buy all the necessary tools. He decided on his business because he wanted to have  independent work. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and paint.

loans.name: Dinamicas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal ”Dinámicas” esta representados por la señora Grabriela y conformada por 10 socios D. los cuales 8 son mujeres y el resto son varones, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre. Grabriela que es la presidenta del grupo está casada y tiene 2 hijos uno que van al colegio y la niña que ya vive D.  forma independiente en su propio hogar, ella se dedica a la venta D. electrodoméstico a crédito en las diferentes zonas y ferias D. la ciudad D. La Paz y El Alto donD. trabajan solo los fines D. semana para poder mantener a su hijo, ella vive en su propia casa por lo que no se preocupan D. alquileres, las expectativas D. Grabriela son D. crecer poco a poco y poder establecerse en un solo local y vender sus electrodomésticos. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, la mayoría venD. artesanías ya sea D. manera ambulante o en puestos fijos, un socio es técnico en celulares y otras se dedican a la venta D. ropa a crédito. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias donD. venden sus productos. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen en su trabajo. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, unos comprarán más productos, otros comprarán materia prima y el resto adquirirá herramientas nuevas D. trabajo. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es D. seguir trabajando para salir adelante y poder tener un hogar al cual puedan darle un futuro mejor. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, el presente por ejemplo es su quinto ciclo en nuestra institución y durante todo el tiempo D. relación comercial ellos demostraron ser personas responsables y puntuales con sus pagos.
texts.en:
The ”Dinámicas” (Dynamic Ones) communal bank is represented by Gabriela and maD. up of 10 members, 8 of whom are women and the rest are men. The bank is characterized by being very united and cheerful. Gabriela is the group president. She is married and has two children; her son, who is a student and a daughter who lives independently in her own home. Gabriela sells home appliances on credit in the various neighborhoods and markets in La Paz and El Alto. She works only on weekends to support her son. She lives in her own home so she doesn’t have to worry about paying rent. Gabriela’s expectations are to grow gradually so that she can establish herself in a single locale to sell her appliances. The rest of the group is involved in various commercial activities; most sell crafts either door-to-door or at fixed stands. One of the members is a cell phone technician and other members sell clothes on credit. In general, the group members have quite a bit of experience in the businesses they have so they are well-known in the various markets where they sell their products. Although there is much competition, the group has experience and regular customers that recognize their work and insist on their services. On the other hand, it is important to note the enthusiasm with which they do their work. They will use the current loan as operational capital. Some will buy more merchandise, others will buy raw ingredients and the rest will buy new work tools. The group’s expectation is to continue to work to get ahead in life and to have a home that they can proviD. a better future for. The bank has an extensive credit history since this isn’t their first loan; it’s their fifth loan with our institution and during our entire commercial relationship they have shown themselves to be responsible and punctual with their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina, de 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores, pues el mayor ya está casado, su casa esta ubicada en un barrio populoso al sur de la ciudad.Antes se dedicaba  a la costura, lo que  era muy agobiante y sobre todo porque descuidaba a sus hijos. Pero desde hace 6 años dejo atrás la costura, y empezó con  el  bordado de  chompas, desde entonces aplica los bordados a todas las chompas que le traen  y que finalmente son exportadas a otros países. Este trabajo le parece  fascinante, ya que puede trabajar en la tranquilidad de su  casa, y además, le pagan regular por cada prenda, dependiendo de la complejidad del paisaje que borda, y la cantidad del avance, es por esta razón  que prefiere realizar todos los bordados posibles. Para más  adelante  su anhelo es abastecerse con gran cantidad de lanas  para poder tejer  y  aplicar los  bordados con tranquilidad,  de ese modo calcula que sus ganancias serian mejores.Es el  séptimo crédito que tiene  con MFP, y  se compromete a ser  puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas.Además Guillermina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  diversos tipos de lanas, con las que aplicará mejor  los bordados a las chompas , y de ese modo espera entregar  oportunamente las chompas.
texts.en:
Guillermina, age 48, lives with her husband and their 2 younger children. Their eldest child is already married. Her house is located in a crowded neighborhood in the south of the city.

Previously, she was employed as a seamstress, but it was very exhausting work, and required her to neglect her children. She left her seamstress job 6 years ago and began embroidering sweaters. Since then she has applied embroidery to all the sweaters that are brought to her, and when they are finished they are exported to other countries. She likes this work a lot since she is able to work in the quiet of her home and, in addition, is paid a set price for each garment depending on the complexity of the design that she embroiders and the amount of work required. For this reason she prefers to accomplish as much embroidery as possible.

In order to get ahead, her wish is to supply herself with a large quantity of wool in order to be able to weave and apply embroidery consistently. She believes that in that way her earnings will be better.

This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with the payment of each one of her installments. Guillermina is planning on investing the loan applied for in the purchase of different types of wool with which she will be able to apply embroidery to sweaters more easily. In this way she hopes to be able to deliver sweaters on time.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase wool in order to continue embroidering.

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es:
Filomena tiene una tienda en su casa que le permite mantener a sus 3 hijos, aperturo su negocio hace varios años cuando atravesó algunos problemas, L. ventaja que elL. tiene es que pueD. coger algunos productos D. su tienda para preparar sus  alimentos, por otro lado L. desventaja que tiene es que con las ventas obtiene menos ganancia aun así elL. es optimista y tiene muchas ganas D. salir adelante es por eso que el grupo L. escogió como presidenta
Guadalupe apoya a su esposo con L. venta D. gelatinas, chupetes y gaseosas, con los pocos ingresos pueD. aportar con los gastos en casa, el préstamo recibido lo invertirá en comprar más productos para L. preparación D. los mismos, algo que le preocupa es que los productos han subido sus costos y tendrá que invertir más D. lo proyectado. Guadalupe es L. secretaria del grupo.
A nuestra socia Victoria le gusta L. cocina así que por las noches se  dedica a  L. venta D. salchipapas, hamburguesas, gaseosa y café en L. puerta D. su casa, eso L. ayuda para solventar L. educación D. sus 4 hijos.
El grupo es unido y responsable y se dedican a diferentes negocios tales como : pequeñas bodegas, preparación y venta D. dulces, venta D. frazadas, y trabajos comunales en diversas zonas aledañas. Ellas agradecen los préstamos obtenidos.
texts.en:
Filomena has a store in her house, allowing her to also take care of her 3 children while working. She opened her store several years ago, when she was going through some hardships. The advantage of her business is that she has household products in stock that she can use for her own family, but then she doesn't earn as much income from sales. Nevertheless, she is optimistic and dedicated to improving, which is why her group chose her as their president. Guadalupe helps her husband by selling gelatin desserts, lollipops, and sodas. With this modest income she can cover household expenses. The loan she received was invested in the purchase of ingredients for the above products. She is worried because the cost of these products have risen, so she now needs more money than she anticipated. Guadalupe is the group secretary. Victoria likes to cook, so at night she sells salchipapas (french fries and hot dogs), hamburgers, soda and coffee outsiD. her house. This activity helps her put her 4 children through school. The group is unified and responsible. They work in different businesses such as small stores, dessert preparation and sales, blanket sales, and community work in nearby regions. The members are grateful for the loans they have received.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and supplies.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 40-year-old entrepreneur from South Cotabato, Philippines. He is married to Annie and they have three children. His eldest is nine years-old. He has a lot of dreams for his children and his priority right now is their education. He works hard to be able to send them to school and also provide for their household needs.

He hopes that his hog-raising business will grow and that he will have a stable income. He has applied for a loan of Php 10,000 from Kiva partner CEVI to have financial assistance for his business. He plans to buy feed and additional piglets.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran A. was born in 1983. He is single. Kamran lives in Baku city with his family. He has been in the consulting business for 3 years. Kamran prepares different types of the materials and print copies and forms which are requested by his clients. Another aspect of his consulting is translation. In order to provide good service to his clients he needs to expand his business by purchasing a new computer, photo copy machine and provide new equipment for a new employee. He is young and his business is new. Karman needs a loan of 2000 AZN to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand the area

loans.name: Renacer En Cristo Group

texts.es: El grupo REnacer en Cristo esta compuesto por tres socios, Roberto (venta de pollitos) Elba (venta de Comida) y Blanca (carpinteria), la mayoria de los socios venden sus productos en una aldea del municipio de Villa Nueva. Roberto tiene un año de vender pollitos se vio en la necesidad de dedicarse a esta actividad ya que antes se dedicaba a la albañileria pero por falta de trabajo y la necesidad de sacar a su familia adelante para brindarles un mejor futuro ahora es comerciante y ha tenido incremento en sus ventas. El sueño de Roberto y de las demas socias es poder crecer como empresarios y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos para que allos puedan ser persona de bien, tambien esperan tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
The group “Renacer en Cristo” (Revived in Christ) consists of three members: Roberto (who sells chicks), Elba (who sells food), and Blanca (who engages in carpentry).

Most of the members sell their products in one of the neighborhoods in the town of Villa Nueva. Roberto began selling chicks a year ago out of necessity. He previously worked as a mason, but due to a lack of jobs he needed a way to support his family and provide them a better future. Roberto is a businessman now and needs to increase his sales. He and the other members want to grow as entrepreneurs and provide a better future for their children so that they can develop into good people. They also hope to gain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for raising & selling chicks

loans.name: Koem Him's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four people from Sman Muni village in Takeo province. They all will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living. 
Mrs. Koem Him E. is the group leader, who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1974. She works at home as a weaver to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Koem Him E. is applying for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Met Khiev, is a construction worker and also a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Mrs. Koem Him E. is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school, while the youngest is two years old.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Guiluna

texts.en:
Guiluna P. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Katipunan, Brgy. Maquiling, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating vegetables vending and food vending businesses.  Her husband Jinky, who works as a Chainsaw helper, also helps his wife.  They have three children who are 16 to 18 years old. 

Guiluna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she wanted something better for her family.  With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Guiluna has been lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000.  

This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to buy vegetables for additional stocks and for future home repairs.  Guiluna P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

---------------------------------
About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana G. D. C. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo D. 67 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a trabajar como agricultor, así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijas las cuales son mayores D. edad, D. quienes una trabaja como empleada, y la menor trabaja junto a su madre en el negocio. Juana  se dedica a la elaboración D. desayunos, refrescos y pupusas, así mismo elabora almuerzos, su ubicación es muy buena, debido a que se encuentra en un lugar llamado el triangulo el cual esta frente a la carretera hacia Santa Ana y a la carretera que se dirige al departamento D. San Salvador. Este es un lugar muy transitado por las personas, debido a que a sus alrededores hay varias fabricas y maquilas, así mismo es un punto D. encuentro para las personas que se dirigen a Quezaltepeque, Santa Ana, San Salvador y Opico, muchas D. estas personas se detienen a consumir alimentos antes D. su trabajo o D. un viaje largo, por lo que Juana cuenta con muy buenas ventas diarias. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su venta D. alimentos, comprando toda la materia prima necesaria para elaborar más alimentos, así D. esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ganancias, lo cual es el objetivo principal para seguir adelante y contar con una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Juana G. D. C., age 52, lives in San Juan Opico, located in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, age 67, who works as a farmer. She also lives with her two daughters who are grown; one works as a maid, and the younger works with her mother in the business. Juana makes breakfasts, drinks and pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans]. She also makes lunches. Her location is very good, since it is in a location called El Triangulo ("The Triangle"), which is in front of the road to Santa Ana and the main road of San Salvador. This is a well-frequented area, since in the vicinity there are several factories and plants. It is also a meeting point for people who are going to Quezaltepeque, Santa Ana, San Salvador and Opico; many of these people stop to eat before their work or long trips, so Juana has very good sales every day. She is requesting a loan to invest in her food sales, purchasing all of the necessary staples for making more food. This way she hopes to increase her earnings, which is her main motivation to succeed and obtain a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of staples for food preparation

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: German Alberto

texts.es:
German Alberto E. S., tiene 46 años.  Es soltero,  vive con la madre, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1hijo, Niurka (6 años). 

German es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

German  se dedica al comercio, a la venta de banano.  Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio y estable para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y la competencia de la localidad.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
German Alberto E. S. is 46 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has one son, Niurka (6 years old). German is a member of the rural bank “Y”, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they have taken out with the San José Cooperative. German sells bananas. He makes the purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo and he sells them in a locale in the house he lives in. He is asking for the loan to grow his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have his own stable business to increase his quailty of life. His challenges are the lack of money and the competition in the area. He likes sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow his business

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles que le ayudaron a ampliar su negocio y con los ingresos educar a sus hijos. Teodosia es casada y tiene 7 hijos, Teodosia viaja diariamente a las ferias de la región en donde compra quesos, animales menores, cereales, productos que comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Teodosia elabora papa seca (papa sancochada, pelada, picada y secada al sol), producto que es utilizada para la preparación de platos típicos.
Teodosia solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa y cereales.
Los sueños de Teodosia son construir su casa pues ahora vive en casa alquilada.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank and what she likes the most are the easy loans that help her to grow her business and with the earnings educate her children. Teodosia is married and has 7 children, Teodosia travels daily to the fairs around the region where she buys cheese,small animals, cereals, products that she markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition Teodosia makes dried potatoes (parboiled, peeled and chopped potatoes dried in the sun), a product that is used in the preparation of typical dishes. Teodosia is asking for a loan of 1500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of potato and cereals. Teodosia dreams of building her home as at the moment she lives in a rented house.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of potato and cereals.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Carlos tiene  45 años de edad, casado hace 15 años tiene  3 hijos  ,  vive en la Urb. Arroyito  propietario, tiene casa propia hace  2 años;  se dedica al transporte hace  7 años, trabaja como chofer de la línea 38 . Su esposa  vende  cosméticos  para ayudar en los gastos familiares. Al  Sr. Juan Carlos  se le otorgo el crédito para  EL mantenimiento de su micro(Chapería). EL señor esta muy agradecidos y sorprendido por la rapidez del crédito y la facilidad del pago.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos, 45, has been married for 15 years. He has 3 children and lives in a house in the Arroyito neighborhood that he has owned for 2 years. He has worked as a driver on the 38 Line for 7 years. His wife sells cosmetics to help with the family's expenses. Sr. Juan Carlos will use the loan for maintenance work on his bus. He is very grateful for the loan and surprised at how quickly he got it and the ease of the payment terms.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance for microbus business.

loans.name: Yesica Liseth

texts.es: Yesica Liseth R. T. de 20 años de edad, es una joven muy emprendedora y visionaria la cual trabaja muy duro por poder salir adelante en la vida. Yesica reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico únicamente junto a su madre quien le ayuda en el negocio, el cual es un comedor, en el que se preparan desayunos y almuerzos. Yesica se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio, ya que es de este del cual dependen para poder suplir todos sus gastos en el hogar, por lo que desea mejorarlo en gran manera, ofreciendo una mayor variedad de platillos, de forma que sus clientes puedan sentirse más estimulados a visitar el comedor. Yesica solicita un préstamo a Integral con el enorme deseo de poder invertir en la compra de verduras, pastas, arroz, frijoles, frutas, bebidas y todo lo necesario para la elaboración de alimentos y de esta forma contar con más materia prima para extender la carta de comida. Con todo lo anterior tanto Yesica como su madre guardan la esperanza de mejorar sus ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida mejor para ambas.
texts.en:
Yesica Liseth R. T. is 20 years old. She is a young entrepreneur and visionary who works extremely hard to get ahead in life. Yesica resides in the town of San Juan Opico and lives with her mother who helps manage her business. She operates a diner where she prepares breakfast and lunch. Yesica devotes herself completely to her business since she relies on it to supply all of her daily needs. Since she wants to improve even more, she tries to offer a variety of dishes to encourage her customers to visit the diner.

Yesica is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral because she wants to invest in the purchase of vegetables, pastas, rice, beans, fruit, beverages, and everything else necessary for preparing her dishes. By having more ingredients, she will be able to expand her menu. Relying on all their previous experiences, Yesica and her mother are hopeful of improving their income so that both of them can have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, basic grains, and other ingredients

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en:
Villamor D. V. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 54 years old. Villamor is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Villamor owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Villamor has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2009, Villamor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Villamor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Villamor is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Villamor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran M. is 49 years old. He has run his own food store since 2004. For almost six years Imran has been selling different kind of goods such as juices, rice, tea, and other merchandise. These products are very popular with his customers.
His monthly income is about 200 to 300 AZN and Imran is planning to increase it to 500 AZN. For this purpose he needs to increase his stock and therefore is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Geovanna Dolores

texts.es:
Geovanna de 42 años, es venderá informal, vive en las Orquideas de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado por que en su descubrimiento hubo muchas flores orquídeas). 

Escogió ser comerciante informal porque le gustaba la venta de bisutería y ropa a nivel particular, comenzó con poca mercadería hasta que incremento su capital tubo que vender a sus vecinos y conocidos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Vende ropa, bisutería a un precio muy barato.  Gracias a que la zona donde vive es comercial hasta ahora no ha tenido problemas con las ventas. 

Quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para incrementar su mercedaria y así sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere tener un local bien adecuado para continuar con sus ventas y un estilo de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Geovanna, age 42, is an informal merchant who lives in Orquideas de Guayaquil (a place known for having several orchids when the area was discovered).

Geovanna chose to become an informal merchant because she enjoys selling jewelry and a particular style of clothing. She began with very little merchandise until she was able to increase her capital by selling to neighbors and acquaintances. At the moment, she works every day between the hours of 9am and midnight. Geovanna sells clothing and jewelry at a very low price. Since she lives in a commercial area, she has no problems making sales.

Geovanna wants to use this loan to increase her inventory of merchandise so that her customers will have more variety from which to buy. In the future, she wants to have a store that is adequate for continuing her sales and will help her achieve a better lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia T. is from the town of Palilan, Jimenez Mis. Occ. Philippines. She is 60 years old and is single. To make a living, Julia owns and operates a retail seafood store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community.  Julia has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Julia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. Julia is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Julia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Norma Nano Group

texts.en:
Norma N. is from the village of Tinacla-an,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years of age and blessed with one child. Norma owns and operates a business venture  in agricultural sector raising livestock. They have been engaged in this business for fifteen years and earn approximately 5000 a month from sales of her livestock.
In 2007, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for their livestock business. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion, the children’s education and future house repairs and renovation.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital of her Livestock

loans.name: Ruslan's Group

texts.en:
What do we need informational technologies for? In a contemporary world we cannot imagine life without a cell phone, computer or TV. The cell phone usage in Kyrgyzstan has risen dramatically in the recent five years. Almost every person right now has at least one cell phone. This growing consumption has caused the cell phone industry to grow very rapidly.

Ruslan N. is a part of this industry too. He is 21 years old and lives in a small Northern town, Karabalta. Ruslan has been selling mobile phones by retail since his teenage years. He spent 100,000 soms for his business start-up, and is earning 30,000 soms a month. Given a piece of advice from his mother, he took a loan from a bank, and repaid it successfully. Ruslan is married, and his spouse is an office manager for a local medical college. This couple has worked hard, and it has given them fruits. They have managed to broaden the business and purchase some furnishings. This loan is needed for adding cell phone accessories to his assortment of goods. The proceeds of business Ruslan plans to spend on a new automobile and maybe open his own store. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Eina

texts.en:
Eina is a mother of one two-year-old son, Khalil, and married to Nael. Eina's husband has a workshop where he fixes and performs maintenance for cars. Eina's husband wants to replace some of the tools he uses and buy some necessary ones.

Eina is an employee and her salary with the husband's income is enough to cover all family expenses.

Eina's husband Nael appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman, as are many Gaza inhabitants.

loans.use: To purchase auto repair tools

loans.name: Mariela Mirella

texts.es:
Mariela de 20 años, aprendió a coser y confeccionar ropa desde que era pequeña ya que su mama le enseño para que tenga una actividad económica y no la agobie la falta de oportunidades.  

Viviendo en una zona periurbana ya tiene varios años en esta actividad. Coser y confeccionar le ha ayudado a solventar los gastos de su único hijo ya que es madre soltera. Trabaja cosiendo y confeccionando desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. Hasta ahora no ha tenido dificultades en su negocio por eso ha continuado trabajando para darle una buena vida a su hijo. 

En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio pero por ahora quiere el préstamo para poder tener más producción comprando una maquina industrial. En el futuro quiere ampliar mas el taller para poder mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mariela, 20 years old, learned to sew and make clothes when she was very young.  Her mother taught her so that she would have a way to make money and so that she wouldn't lack for opportunities. 

Living in a peri-urban zone, she now has been sewing for many years.   Sewing and making clothes has helped her to pay for the costs of raising her only son as a single mother.  She works sewing and making clothes from 8:00am until 6:00pm every day.  So far she has not had difficulties with her business and has continued to work to be able to give her son a good life.

In the future she would like to continue with her business but right now she wants a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine so she can increase her production. In the future she would like to make her work space bigger so that she can bring in more income.

loans.use: Industrial Sewing Machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and one sibling. He's owned an air conditioning products and appliances store for 22 years. He is the only income source for the family. He obtained his first Kiva loan and was a very good client with punctual payments.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1700 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new tools and equipment so he can proceed with his work properly.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and equipment

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
la señora Blanca Azucena O. es una mujer honrada, trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio propio, que es venta de abarroteria en general, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Concepcion de la ciudad de Choluteca, ahi vende sus productos a un gran numero de personas que la visitan de muchas aldeas cercanas, Blanca empieza a atender en su negocio desde las 7 de la manaña hasta las 5 de la tarde todos los dias y asi de esta manera poder satifacer todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
Trabaja muy fuerte cada dia para salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca Azucena O. is an honest, hardworking woman who has her own business selling groceries and other supplies to the many people who visit her store from nearby villages. The store is located in the Concepcion market in the town of Choluteca. 

Blanca tries to be open from 7am to 5pm every day to attend to the needs of her customers. She works very hard each day to get ahead and have a better standard of living. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, oil etc to stock her store

loans.name: Polvondjon

texts.en: Polvondjon is 25 years old. He is a farmer growing vegetables, something he has done for 10 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Polvondjon, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. Now he wants to borrow money for purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants in order to grow seasonal vegetables. Polvondjon has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Otilia  tiene  40  años y está casada con Hugo M., quien no participa del crédito por encontrarse D. viaje.
Ellos viven en la Ciudad D. San Lorenzo a unos 40 Km D. su lugar D. trabajo, ellos tienen un Puesto D. venta en el Mercado Municipal D. San Lorenzo a pocas cuadras D. la oficina D. Fundación Paraguaya y trabajan allí todos los días, inclusive los domingos.
Viajan a la madrugada para estar en su puesto antes D. las 6 D. la mañana, hora en que llegan los pescados D. varios puertos del país.
Con este crédito piensan comprar una congeladora y mayor cantidad D. pescados.
texts.en:
Sra. Otilia is 40 years old and married to Hugo M., who is not participating in this loan because he travels on the road. They live in the city of San Lorenzo, which is approximately 40 km from the place where they work. Otilia and her husband have a vending stall at the San Lorenzo Muncipal Market, which is a few blocks away from the Fundación Paraguaya office. They work at the market every day, including Sundays.

Otilia and her husband must leave at dawn in order to get to their vending post before 6am, the hour when most of the fish arrives from various ports. With this loan, she wants to buy a freezer and a large quantity of fish.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and large quantity of fish.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi B. is single. He lives in the town of Tlumach in the Ivano-Frankivsk region. 

Vitalyi runs a service station in downtown Tlumach where he rents a facility for business purposes. His maintenance station offers running gear repairs, tire vulcanization and wheel geometry services. Vitalyi has one hired employee working for him at the station. He started the venture two years ago. His current monthly income amounts to 12,000 UAH. 

Vitalyi is requesting a 20,000 UAH loan to purchase two automobiles to break down for spare parts. He is planning to sell the dismantled spare parts at a good price and thus generate additional income as a result. One of Vitalyi’s dreams is to do a major makeover in his two-room apartment and construct his own service station in the outskirts of his home town close to a local tourist complex.

loans.use: to purchase two automobiles for dismantling

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara, de 31 años vive con su esposo Juan, y sus 4 hijos, en la vivienda de sus suegros, ubicado en la ciudad de Tarma, donde sus hijos tienen mayores oportunidades académicas. Su habilidad hacen que cada cosecha se comercialice de manera rápida y a buen precio, pues es una de las mejores productoras de papa, por eso los mayoristas ya la conocen y le compran debido a la calidad de sus productos que es incomparable a las demás productores de papa. Lleva 14 años dedicada a la agricultura, y junto a su esposo cada se intensifican en la siembra de papa de la variedad “yungay”, “única” y de diferentes colores, pues cada color tiene otro sabor. Llo que más le gusta es ofrecer sus productos en el mercado central de Tarma  y  en la ciudad de La Merced, que pertenece a la selva peruana, donde vende el tubérculo por menudeo, por kilos. Ella se considera una mujer de negocio, por eso en adelante planea tener una tienda de comestibles que construirá en el interior de su casa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los sanjuanitos de hacienda huay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde reafirma que le gusta laborar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, porque son personas unidas y responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará fertilizantes naturales y abono orgánico para asegurar su producción.
texts.en:
Clara, 31, lives with her husband, Juan, and their four children in her in-laws’ house located in the city of Tarma where her children’s educational opportunities are better.  

Her skills insure that each of her harvests is sold quickly and at a good price because she’s one of the best potato producers and wholesalers know her and buy from her thanks to the quality of her products which is superior to the other potato producers.

She’s been farming for 14 years and, together with her husband she concentrates on farming “Yungay” and “Única” varieties of potato in various colors because each color represents a different flavor.

What she enjoys the most is selling her products in Tarma’s market and in the city of La Merced, which is part of the Peruvian jungle, where she sells the tuber at retail by the kilogram. She considers herself a businesswoman and plans in the future to have a grocery store she’ll build in the interior of her house.

She is a member of the “Los Sanjuanes de Hacienda Huay” communal bank and this is the fifth loan with MFP where she reaffirms that she enjoys working with the members of her communal bank because they are united and responsible people.  She will use the requested loan to buy natural fertilizer and organic manure to assure production.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria Esperanza es una mujer casada de 53 años, que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 17 y 22 años; ella habita  en la “Ciudadela Metropolitana”,  barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, en el cual la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  en su tarea misional, apoyó la construcción de su comunidad. Maria Esperanza tiene su propio negocio, que nació por la necesidad de apoyar la gestión de ingresos para su hogar,  que antes estaba a cargo de su cónyuge solamente;    así ella mediante su trabajo independiente aporta al hogar para poder brindarles  a sus hijos un futuro exitoso, con el que ella y su esposo sueñan. Entre las actividades que desempeña Maria, están la confección de ropa femenina sobre medidas y la venta de mercancías sobre los  pedidos que realizan sus clientes. Con su credikiva que es su primer financiamiento, comprará telas, hilos e insumos de confección, pues tiene ropa encargada por parte de sus clientes,  porque quieren estar muy elegantes debido a la celebración del día de las madres;  así mismo responderá a pedidos de perfumes, ropa interior, y cosméticos en los cuales invertirá con este mismo propósito.  Su sueño es terminar de adecuar  su vivienda e independizar el negocio y tener su propio local,  para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes donde se sientan confortables y los impulse a fidelizarse. Su desafío desde que comenzó el negocio ha sido el poco capital de trabajo con el que cuenta, pues en oportunidades le impide cumplir compromisos futuros o ser oportuna con sus clientes. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual se ha vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para superar los actuales desafíos.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza is 53 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 17 and 22. She lives in “Ciudadela Metropolitana”, a neighborhood located in the municipality of Soledad, where Fundación Mario Santo Domingo is working to help develop the community. Maria Esperanza has her own business, which she started to provide additional household income. Before, the family depended completely on Maria Esperanza's husband. Through her business, Maria Esperanza is also able to support her children and prepare them for a successful future, something she and her husband both dream of. 

Maria's business activities include making custom women's clothing and selling various requested products. With her Kiva loan, which is her primary source of financing, Maria Esperanza will buy fabric, thread, and sewing supplies for her tailoring business. She currently has many orders from her customers, who want elegant clothing to wear for Mother's Day. She also has outstanding orders for perfume, underwear, and cosmetics that she will use the loan to buy.

Her dream is to finish work on her home and to be able to set up her business in its own location, which will provide a better shopping experience for her customers and help her gain customer loyalty. Maria Esperanza's biggest challenge is accumulating enough working capital, something she has struggled with since she began her business. This prevents her from being able to take advantage of growth opportunities, which is why she works with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to overcome this challenge.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, and sewing materials for making custom clothing and to buy perfume, underwear and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: John A.s.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers from the Benevolent Islamic Primary School, Magburaka.  This school was built by the Benevolent Mission in 1982. It has a total of 20 staff and 656 pupils.

This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 13,000,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, some of these teachers will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects. With their monthly salaries, they will gradually repay their loan to SMT. 

John A.S. K. is the Deputy Head Teacher at the school. The 40-year-old has been in the teaching profession for eleven years now. John is married to a businesswoman and the two of them have four children together. With this loan, John will buy house equipment like a refrigerator and a generator.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a generator.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been practising farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 29 years.  He is 61 years old, married to Tabitha, and they have two children.  

Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fifth loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  Peter plans to use this loan amount to buy oat seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy oat seeds and fertilizer, and hire field workers

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 29-year-old married man and a father of 3 children. He has worked in agriculture since 2001, and he started raising his own cattle, trading with their milk, and farming in 2008.

Hussein likes his business a lot and works hard to improve it. He has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy a new cow, which will help increase his dairy production and support him financially.

Hussein works hard to provide his children with the best living and hopes to provide them with the best education ever. His clients like dealing with him a lot because of his high-quality products. He hopes to increase his cattle herd and improve the quantity and quality of his farming.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase his cattle herd and dairy production

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with five children. 

Clemencia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Clemencia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Clemencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sindre

texts.en:
Sindre is 33 years old and married to Sampeny. They are blessed with children. She owns a jewelry and animal feeds store in Enkaroni where she operates her business. Most of her clients are females. She gets an income of about 4,000 (~$47) per month.

Sindre he was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. She has a good credit history with KADET, and she is applying for her second loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD with which she plans to purchase textiles and more animal feeds.

She will use the extra profit to pay school fees for her children. Sindre hopes to start an agrovet (animal clinic). She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and more animal feeds.

loans.name: Aner Eliu

texts.es: El señor Aner, es habitante de municipio de Veracruz , junto a su esposa , los planes hacia un futuro es poder terminar de construir su vivienda , ya que con créditos anteriores ah logrado construir gran parte de la misma , el labora en una empresa privada , la mayor afectación  que se le presenta es no poder contar con un  salario que cubra de una sola vez la  compra de materi ales de construcción como  de zinc , perlines , entre otros .
texts.en: Aner lives with his wife in the municipality of Veracruz. Their plan for the future is to finish building their house, since with previous loans they've been able to construct a large part of it. He works in a private business. The main problem is not having a salary that will cover the costs of all the construction materials like tin roofing and rafter beams, among other things.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nora Hilda

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Nora le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita que es cemento, pintura y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica, ya es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y que estén más seguros y así poder evitar enfermedades por la humedad.
texts.en:
Nora's house is lacking the finishing touches on its exterior.  She requests a loan so that she can buy the materials she needs such as cement and paint, and so that she can hire a person to do this work.  She plans to pay off the loan with part of the earnings she obtains from her work in a factory.  She is a single mother with 2 children in her care.

She wants to improve the family's property and make it more secure, and in this way avoid the illnesses that can occur when moisture seeps into a house.

loans.use: to do finishing work on the exterior of her house

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Guadalupe se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del grupo desarrollan actividades de forma conjunta y dentro de un ambiente de solidaridad y respeto mutuo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades que fortalecen y fomentan su compañerismo.
Se definen como mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan día a día por obtener mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan brindarles a sus hijos y familiares una vida mejor.
La Señora Lidia es comerciante, es decir se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de artículos, como ser frazadas, sabanas y demás, a lo que se dedica hace ya unos años. Ella gracias a esto ha logrado mantener a sus familiares. Sueña con algún día poder tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer los productos que vende, ya que sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frazadas, artículos de mercería, y demás para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Guadalupe Group was formed by several neighbors in the city of Santaní.  All of the group members work together in solidarity and mutual respect.  They are a very close group capable of working together to strengthen their camaraderie.

They are defined as female heads of household and work daily to make higher earnings in order to provide their families with a better life.

Lidia is a merchant who has been in this business for several years now.  Thanks to this job, she has been able to support her family members.  She dreams of one day having a store from which to sell her products, as she currently makes her sales on foot.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of blankets, notions and other items to later sell.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they have given her.

loans.use: to buy blankets, notions and other items to sell.

loans.name: Maykol Jaxon

texts.es: Maykol Jaxon  de 24 años trabaja como docente del ceta Inatec desde hace 2 años, solicita este credito para construir una habitaciòn y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia, este joven es bien querido por sus vecinos, compañeros de trabajo ya que es bien humilde y sencillo, su mayor sueño es estudiar una post grado  para adquirir nuevos conocimientos  y continuar trabajando con los creditos para asi poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Maykol Jaxon is 24 years old and has worked for two years as a teacher at the National Institute of Technology, Center for Agricultural and Technical Education. He is requesting this loan to build a room and thereby improve his and his family's living conditions. This young man is beloved by his neighbors and coworkers because he is very humble and kind. His greatest dreams are to pursue graduate studies so he can acquire more knowledge and to continue to work with these loans, which make it possible for him to improve his home and living conditions little by little.

loans.use: to build a room onto his house

loans.name: Yairo Francisco

texts.es: Yairo Francisco tiene 28 años, su actividad es crianza y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que  El trabajo al que se dedica es muy pesado pero le gusta, hace mucho tiempo empezó esta actividad porque en su familia tenían este negocio fue con el tiempo aprendió. La pasión que le pone a su trabajo lo ha convertido en un buen  hombre y por ello se ha ganado los reconocimientos de todos los que lo conocen. El siempre está viendo la manera de mejorar su trabajo, por tal motivo solicita este crédito para comprar cerdos y alimentos para los mismos.
texts.en: Yairo Francisco is 28 years old and works raising and selling pigs.  He has done this work for more than 6 years, and it is very hard work, but he likes it.  He started working in this business a long time ago because his family worked in it and he learned it with time.  The effort he has put into his work has made him a good man and he has earned the recognition of those who know him.  He is always looking for ways to improve his business which is why he is asking for a loan to buy pigs and pig food.

loans.use: buy pigs and pig food

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Geralyn has a shop business, buying and peddling fish like sardines, flying fish & milk fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.

Geralyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Geralyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and blessed with three children. She lives with her family in a village and generates her income through vegetable production and sale. She earns about PHP500 each week doing this type of business. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs sufficiently and to save for the future of her children.

At this time, she has planted more vegetables expecting to increase her production next season, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP7,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production. She believes that the loan will help her increase her yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 49 years old and a widow. She supports four children aged 16, 15, 14 and 12. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past six years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.


This is Margaret's second loan term with KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use this loan amount to purchase chicken feed and seedlings for planting. 


Anticipated profits will be used to buy more chickens to improve her business. Her dream is to expand and have a stable income to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and seedlings

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun is now a 48-years-old, married woman who has been residing in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Most of the people who live there prefer doing farming for their livelihoods to other careers. One among them, Roeun, is in the business of cultivating rice crops. She typically earns an income of $1.50 each day from this business. She is diligent in working because she wants to support her single child to join a university. Besides farming, Roeun is also skillful in making plastic kindling, which can be used by housewives to make fire for cooking. She has operated this business since 2010.  It can make additional profit for her family. Presently, she has run out of raw materials from her stock. Thus, she is looking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase raw materials for making plastic kindling. She’ll be able to run this business continually through using this loan from lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making plastic kindling.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man with four school-going children. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. Samson lives in a rental house without electricity or running water and his greatest monthly expense is food for his family. For the last four years, he has operated an agro-vet supply business and his clients are local area farmers. Samson’s major business challenge is seasonality. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it provides financial services to low income earners.
 
Samson is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more fertilizer and pesticide to sell. In the future, he dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is single and blessed with a ten year old child who is in school. She has been selling charcoal for the past three years to make a living. Grace has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to access loans to boost her business and also to improve her living standards. In the next 5 years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. Grace has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to renovate her business premises.

loans.use: to renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou a été crée le 20 avril 2010. Il compte 8 femmes toutes issues de la même localité et exerçant la même activité.
La responsable du groupe ,madame Tening,debout à droite de la photo et levant la main,est agéé de 39 ans. Elle mariée et mére de 04 enfants.
Son pret recu lui permettra de vendre du poisson et des fruits(oranges, mangues), selon la période. Elle est très expérimentée dans la vente pour l'avoir fait pendant plusieurs années.
Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'améliorer ses conditions de vie et assure une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Fallou solidarity group was set up on April 20 2010. The group is made up of 8 women all from the same area and working in the same business. 

The group's leader, Madame Tening, standing at right with her hand raised,  is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children. Her loan will allow her to sell fish and fruit (oranges and mangoes) depending on the season. She has been selling for several years and has plenty of experience. The profit she makes will allow her to improve her living conditions and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fish and fruit.

loans.name: Rose

texts.es: Rose, de 34 años, es una mujer buena, amable y trabajadora, esta separada, pero vive con sus dos hijos de 17 y 04 años. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres, su hermana y sus sobrinos. El trabajo de Rose consiste en la venta de cerveza, todos los lunes realiza su pedido a las distribuidoras con las que trabaja, pone a helar y vende a sus clientes que siempre van a su casa en busca de una cerveza muy helada. Ella es muy responsables y es por eso que solo vende a personas mayores de edad y con acreditación de mayoría en mano, además de vencer bebidas alcohólicas también vende gaseosas, hielo y chupetes de frutas regionales. Aún recuerda el primer día que se puso a vender y todos los temores y dudas que tenía, pero de a poco fue consolidándose y aprendiendo el negocio, ahora es una gran vendedora y tiene muchos clientes. Su plan es montar una fuente de soda y empezar mas adelante a ser distribuidora, pero por el momento solo quiere consolidarse y crecer de a poco. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y así seguir siendo una socia puntual como en el crédito anterior que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más bebidas alcohólicas, además de gaseosas e ingrediente y mas insumos para seguir preparando sus chupetes.
texts.en:
Rose, 34, is a good, kind, hard-working woman who is divorced.  She lives with her two children, ages 17 and 4, in her parents' home where her sister and nieces and nephews also live.  Rose sells beer, and every Monday she places an order through the distributors she works with.  She keeps the beer on ice so that customers can come to her house any time and get cold beer.  She is very responsible and only sells to adults who bring their I.D.  In addition to alcoholic beverages she also sells sodas, ice and popsicles made with regional fruit.  

She still remembers the first day she started selling, and all the fear and doubts she had, but little by little she learned about the business and was able to consolidate it, and now she is a great saleslady and has many customers.  Her goal is to establish a soda fountain and in the future become a distributor.  But for now she wants to focus on her business and continue growing gradually.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is counting on you to help her reach her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and continue being a punctual member as with previous loans.  She plans to use the 1,500 PEN loan to buy alcoholic beverages, sodas and ingredients and supplies to make popsicles.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas, and fruit to make popsicles.

loans.name: Ñepuaverekavo Group

texts.es:
Ñepuaverekavo es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Concepción, gracias a que una de las miembros se había informado acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Después ella comento a sus amigas y vecinas y ellas encantadas decidieron formar parte del desafío. Actualmente son 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran muy felices dentro del grupo, trabajando en equipo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Nilsa, quien nos cuenta que vende todo tipo de prendas, dice que por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y de esa forma tener los medios necesarios para mejorar la vida que llevan. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora cuyo sacrificio es por su familia, ya que no quiere que pasen por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ñepuaverekavo is the name of this group formed in the city of Concepción, thanks to one of the members who learned about the Fundación Paraguaya’s program of women entrepreneurs. Later she told her friends and neighbors. Delighted, they decided to take up the challenge. Currently, there are 15 women in the group, who are very happy to be working together as a team.

One of the members of the group is Señora Nilsa, who tells us that she sells all types of clothing. 	She says that, by means of this business, she has been able to help her family and have the means necessary to better their lives. She defines herself as a hard-working fighter whose sacrifices are for her family, as she doesn’t want them to suffer any hardships.

She requests this loan for the purchase of clothing with which she will be able to stock her business, and subsequently have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: For the past five years Leonisa, a 50-year-old married mother of seven living in the Philippines, has operated a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2007, she has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Leonisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Mechoacan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Santa Cruz de Mechoacan , esta conformado por mujeres indígenas con deseos de superarse y ayudar a las personas de su localidad.
Las mujeres de este grupo son muy creativas todas a parte de dedicarse a otras cosas , se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías como son manteles ,servilletas y huipiles.
Una de las integrantes de el  grupo es la señora  Rosalba quien se dedica a la venta antojitos mexicanos desde hace dos años ya que le gusta mucho cocinar y alimentar a sus paisanos.
 Ella nos cuenta que lo que vende es: enchiladas ,entomatadas, caldo  de res y caldo de pollo y pollo en mole verde.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Aurelio con quien tiene cinco hijos dos mujeres y tres varones , tanto su esposo como sus hijos la ayudan en la venta de comida.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de chiles verdes, chiles  secos,jitomates,ajos ,pollo  y carne de res.
*En el grupo hay dos marías una se dedica ala venta de antojitos y la otra a la venta de pollos.

Las otras integrantes son:
Angélica Beatriz-se dedica a la venta antojitos mexicanos.
Soledad- se dedica a la venta de artesanías como son servilletas, manteles  y huipiles.
Ilda – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Emilia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Reyna-se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Emilia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
María –se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Sonia-se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Himelda se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
María –se dedica a la venta de pollos mayoreo y menudeo.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudarlas a seguir triunfando cada día  y darles una mejor vidas a sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is called Santa Cruz de Mechoacan.  Its members are indigenous women who want to excel and help those in their town.  The women in this group are very creative and are dedicated to different activities.  They make handcrafts such as tablecloths, napkins and huipiles [traditional Mayan tunics].  One of the members is Señora Rosalba and she has been selling Mexican snacks for two years as she like to cook and feed her fellow countrymen.  She tells us she sells enchiladas, entomatadas, beef soup, chicken soup and chicken in green mole.  She is happily married to Señor Aurelio with whom she has five children, two girls and three boys.  Her husband, as well as her children, help her with her food sales.  She is requesting a loan to buy green chilies, dried chilies, tomatoes, garlic, chicken, and beef. 

*In this group there are two Marías.  One sells snacks and the other sells chickens.  

The other members are Angélica Beatriz, Ilda, Emilia, Reyna, Emilia, María, Sonia and Himelda, all of whom sell Mexican snacks; Soledad sells crafts such as tablecloths,napkins and huipiles; María sells chickens wholesale and retail.  They are grateful to Fundación for helping them to continue succeeding every day and giving their families a better life.

loans.use: purchase supplies to make traditional foods.

loans.name: Manuel Concepcion

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negoco de restaurant,el socio prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,el socio tambien vende chicha de jora que es una bebida a base de maiz,el socio tambien vende frutillada,el socio ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el restaurant.El socio solicita el credito para comprar carne,pollo,arroz y verduras.

El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working in his restaurant where he prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  He also sells chicha, which is a fermented corn-based drink.  He also sells frutillada, a fermented corn-based drink that contains strawberry.  He has worked in this business for 7 years and it is going very well.  His dream is to grow his restaurant.  He is seeking this loan so that he can buy meat, chicken, rice and vegetables.

He is very thankful for this loan and promises to comply with the re-payment terms.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, and vegetables.

loans.name: Sharifali

texts.ru: Шарифали 34 летный житель района Джоми. Он семейный мужчина. У него 2, 4 и 6 летные детишки. Жене тоже 34 года. Она занимается растениеводством во дворе. Шарифали имеет свой собственный бизнес. Он занимается животноводством более 10 лет. Шарифали научился от своего отца. Он освоил все навыки выращивание скота. Шарифали выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Он хочет приобрести еще пару скатов для увеличения их численность.  Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему приобрести скота и сохранит свой бизнес. Шарифали верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для купли несколько крупнорогатого скота.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of chemicals in the business

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 39 and has 2 children. He is the only breadwinner in the family. He has been engaged in this business for 8 years. He has an ability to buy the best perfumes. He is very polite with all his clients. Arif decided to apply for a loan $500 in order take advantage of the busy retail trade. The second time he borrowed t $800 and varied the perfumes. The third time he borrowed $900 in order to rent the perfume store.
He applies for a loan of $1200 to open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods.

loans.use: To open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Toan

texts.en: Toan is 38. Her husband is Huy, 40. They have one daughter and 2 sons between 10 and 16. They don’t have any land for cultivation, so it is difficult for their family to earn a living. However, their children go to school. Huy, her husband is a daily laborer, but the work is not stable. Selling soya-milk for breakfast is therefore important for them, increasing their very small income about $8/person/month. She wants to borrow a loan of $50 so that she can buy an amount of soya with cash so that it is cheaper.

loans.use: selling soya-milk for breakfast

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. M. is 24 years old with a daughter aged 4. She joined TYM in 2003. From her first loans, her husband bought a little old pick-up truck to offer transportation services in their neighborhood. Mrs. M. sells cosmetics at the local market. They also have a small rice field and fruit garden. Mrs. M. is a TYM center chief and organizes monthly meetings of all borrowers in her village.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Meak

texts.en:
Mrs. Meak S. is a 40-year-old mother of 3 children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Mrs. Meak Saron works in a theatre as an actress, and earns around $1 each day. Her husband works as a policeman and typically makes about $1.50 a day.

Mrs. S. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, so he can work part-time as a taxi driver to generate more income.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle to operate a business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Carlos will use the loan to buy an industrial juicer for his business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyen Thi T., 35 years old, makes mat to earn a living. She also raise 3 pigs to increase her income. She has 3 small children, from 4 to 10 years old, all of them are going to school. She looks a bit older than her real age due to all these years trying to make ends meet. When TYM Fund (Kiva partner) started to give out loans in her commune, Mrs. T. discussed with her husband and decided to borrow from TYM Fund. The loan has helped her a lot. This is sedge harvest season, so she wants to borrow 400USD to buy sedge when it is cheap.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Công việc hàng ngày của chị Nguyễn Thị Tươi, 35 tuổi, là dệt chiếu. Ngoài ra chị còn nuôi thêm 3 con lợn để tăng nguồn thu nhập. Nuôi 3 con nhỏ tuổi từ 4 đến 10 đang đi học trông chị già dặn hơn so với tuổi bởi những vất vả lo toan cho cuộc sống. Khi Quỹ TYM về với quê hương chị đã bàn bạc với chồng sử dụng vốn vay từ Quỹ và thấy phù hợp mang lại hiệu quả cao. Đang vào mùa thu hoạch cói chị đã đề nghị vay mức vốn 400USD để mua thêm nguyên liệu khi giá đang rẻ.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru:
Hikmatullo G. is 25 years old, has a college education, is an economist by profession, is married and does not have children. After finishing university, Hikmatullo could not find a job in his profession, because there were no vacancies. He plans to use the loan to purchase young calves to feed and resell.
