He has been in this business for 2 years. He will sell the calves every 40-45 days and then use the earnings to purchase new calves. He will use his profits to support his family. Hikmatullo plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гургов Хикматулло, возраст – 25 лет, образование высшее, по специальности – экономист, женат, детей не имеет. После окончания университета Хикматулло на смог найти себе работу по специальности по причине отстутсвия вакантных мест. Он, на полученнй кредит планирует приобрести молодых бычков для откормки и продажи. Этим видом деятельнсти он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Он будет продавать скот через каждые 40-45 дней, после продажи он будет приобретать молодняк и откармливать. Заработанную прибыль он будет использовать для содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis A. owns a garage specializing in Mercedes Benz repairs. He acquired his mechanical experience and knowledge from working for several years at a large, well-known garage in the city.

Luis comes from a humble family, for whom he began to work at a very early age. After saving some money, he started his garage in a location which he currently rents. His proposed goal is to open his garage at a location of his own, and he has already purchased some land for this purpose. He is now seeking to buy additional land and start building.

To reach his goal, he asks for a loan of $1,075, which he will invest in the purchase of additional land.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis A., posee un taller mecánico para autos especialmente de la marca Mercedes Benz. Las habilidades y conocimientos los ha adquirido luego de trabajar varios años como ayudante en un taller grande y reconocido de la ciudad.

Luis proviene de una familia humilde, por lo que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar. Luego de ahorrar dinero, monto su taller que se encuentra hoy día en un lugar alquilado. El proyecto que tiene Luis es la de montar su taller en un local propio, para ello ha comprado un terreno y ahora desea comprar otro terreno más para luego empezar a construir su local propio.

Para poder cumplir su meta, solicita hoy un crédito de $ 1.075 que los invertirá en la compra de un terreno mas.

loans.use: Purchase land.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
N. Comfort is trader who sells both soft and alcoholic drinks. She is married to a sanitation officer and has 5 children. She plans on expanding her business, but lacks adequate funds.

She is asking for $525 as an additional capital to buy increase her stock of drinks and expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase stock

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en: Mohammad Nahim lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children. He has a shoe shop. He makes shoes himself and sends them to the main bazaar of Kabul for shopkeepers to sell. His business is small so he wants to enlarge it. He requested an individual loan to buy new machines and complete his last purchase. He wants to make a good income and support his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Kimlun

texts.en:
Kimlun S., 34, lives with her parents and sisters on an island in Cambodia's Mekong River. She has two sisters, who are married, one sister who lives at home, and two brothers who are in school.

Since she was a child, Kimlun has woven silk to earn money. She sells her finished products to a middle man in her village who sells them in the capital city of Phnom Penh. To grow her business, Kimlun is requesting a loan of $200 U.S. dollars to purchase more raw silk.

loans.use: To purchase silk to weave into cloth

loans.name: Ester Jiret Group

texts.en:
Yesenia is a funny and bright-eyed woman who lives with her husband and sonin the community of Los Alcarrizzos. She runs a small business out of her home selling curtains, sheets and a cloth home accessory that is very popular in the Dominican Republic. She has requested this loan to buy a few new kinds of fabric which are new to the area, but which she knows will be a hit with existing and new customers. Because summer is beginning, when the heat is often unbearable, people want materials that are bright, beautiful, and which help block the sun from their homes, and Yesenia plans to use this loan to buy material that will fit this need perfectly.

She hopes that this money will help her and her husband improve their lives enough so they can afford three meals a day, and so that their son has the opportunity to grow up in health and happiness. She hopes that the boy grows up to become not only a man of God, but a man who does well for he community. She herself hopes to always continue improving her life and business, and when asked what challenges she faces in her life, replied with a simple "Yo puedo," brushing off the idea that something might keep her down, and saying matter-o- factly, “I can.”

loans.use: To invest money in her home accessories business

loans.name: Patt

texts.en: Patt Y., 43, is married and lives with her three children in Siem Reap Province where she raises pigs, typically making $5 each day, while her husband is a farmer earning less than $1 per day.  Inconsistent weather conditions and high inflation have made Cambodia a very difficult place for farming. Many farmers are struggling to make ends meet with the high food prices and lack of necessary rains. In the midst of economic struggles, though, Patt Y. has seen how she can expand her pig business and increase her daily income. She has asked CREDIT for a loan of $700 to split the money between the purchase of more pigs and the purchase of pig feed. She believes this will be a sustainable investment that can increase her income in the long-term and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Lesbia Maria T. is 45 years old, and a single mother of two. Her children are 13 and 14 years old, respectively, and both attend the public secondary school. The family doesn't receive economic help from anyone, so Lesbia is asking for a loan of 9000 Cordobas in order to expand her business. Lesbia sells breakfast in her home, and with a loan she'll also be able to sell lunch from a small stall in the bus terminal market. In the afternoons, she serves fried snacks to students in the area. Lesbia started this business 8 years ago, as an alternative to unemployment and in order to get ahead. Her dream is to install a restaurant and bar in her home, but she'll continue to grow her current business in order to earn the capital for renovations. With your help Lesbia may be able to realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lesbia Maria T., tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, de 13 y 14 años respectivamente, ambos niños cursan la secundaria en colegio publico, ya que no tiene ayuda economica de nadie mas. En esta oportunidad solicita un credito por la suma de C$ 9,000.00 cordobas con el proposito de poder ampliar su negocio ya que solamente vendia comida en el desayuno en su casa de habitación,con los creditos ahora vende tambien almuerzo en el mercado la terminal de buses teniendo un pequeño espacio donde ofrece su servicio, y por la tarde saca una pequeña fritanga en su casa, sus principales clientes son estudiantes del sector, Ella tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual surge como una alternativa de subsitencia al desempleo y poder salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es el unico sosten del hogar. Su mayor sueño es llegar a instalar un Bar y comedor en su casa de habitación, pero para ello requiere un mayor capital, y acondicionar el local para poder salir adelante, que con el apoyo nuestro quizas se le permita concretizar sus sueños.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara C. is a 51-year-old woman. She is a widow with three children. They live in the town of Shahrituz, Tajikistan. Gulsara sells national fabrics at the local market. She works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high because the national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and very important dowry items for any girl. Gulsara has been in this business for 12 years. She has always been an active and enthusiastic entrepreneur. Now her children are grown up and they always try to help their mother with the business, as you can see in this photo of Gulsara’s eldest son.

Today Gulsara is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 3 months to increase her available capital. She believes the profits she will be able to generate will not only help her keep a stable position in the market but will also offer a better livelihood for her grandkids. Gulsara has been a role model of discipline, accuracy and responsibility. Difficult family circumstances and ill health have not hindered consistent growth in her business. IMON (Kiva’s Field Partner) believes her perseverant work and natural liveliness will help Gulsara continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of new fabric to broaden her selection of goods

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
This is a 45-year-old married woman with three children aged between 19 and 22. Her name is Hamisa R.. She started her stationery business in 2000 and she sells office equipment such as books and pens. She also offers secretarial services such as printing, lamination and typing. One employee and her husband are the only people assisting her to run this business.

Currently Hamisa has been earning a monthly profit of $110. She is requesting a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock: books, glue, writing pads, and counter books. Hamisa works six days per week and 10 hours per day. In future she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock.

She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks books, glue, writing pads, and counter books.

loans.name: Perlas De Oriente Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Perla de Oriente, esamos ubicadas en el municipio de danli, nosotras nos conocemos muy bien y hemos trabajado juntas siempre, ya que somos vecinas.
nuestro grupo se integra de la siguiente forma:
Santos H.: soy la coordinadora del grupo, vendo cosmeticos y ropa, actividad que realizo hace varios años y atravez de este negocio he sacado ganancias para contribuir con los gastos del hogar y asi poder mejorar nuestras condiciones de vida.
Maria P.: ella vende cosmeticos y ropa, tiene mas de 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la cual realiza de forma ambulante y domiciliar, este negocio es su fuente de generacion de dinero, y con las ganancias que ella obtiene ayuda a cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
Margarita F.: la actividad de ella es la venta de medicina popular tiene 2 años de vender este tipo de producto, ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para invertir en su negocio e implementar nuevos productos.
por tal razon nosotras hemos dedicido obtener un credito monetario para poder abastecernos de productos y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the group, Pearl of the Orient, and we are located in the town of Danli. Since we are neighbors, we know each other very well, and we have always worked together. Our group is composed as follows: Santos H.: I am the coordinator of the group, and I sell cosmetics and clothes. I started selling these products several years ago, and through this business, I have made profits to help with my household expenses and in order to improve our living conditions. Maria P.: She sells cosmetics and clothes and has more than six years of experience engaging in this type of business, which she performs while traveling and at home. This business is her source of generating money, and with the profits that she gets, she helps to cover household expenses. Margarita F.: Her business is the selling of popular medicines, and she has two years experience selling these types of products. She does not have sufficient working capital to invest in her business and implement new products. For this reason, we are dedicated to getting a monetary loan in order to supply more products and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of goods, cosmetics, clothing, medicine, etc.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Houn D., 44, (pictured with her husband in their jicama farm) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Moeun, 43, live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Both of their daughters are married, one of whom lives in the family home. One son is a driver and other son studies in a local school.

Houn and her husband have been farming since they were married in 1986. They grow rice, other crops and vegetables in their farmland in the village. Houn is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase rice seed for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed for growing rice.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.en: N. Makhfirat is a 55 year old woman, married with 3 children. The diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Makhfirat. After trying her luck at a variety of occupations, she decided to work in the area of livestock. She started this business 10 years ago with the support of her husband. Now Makhfirat has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge regarding this activity. She would like to expand her activity by purchasing more cattle so she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Makhfirat is requesting a loan of 1700 Somoni ($500 US Dollars). She has agreed to repay this loan within 12 months. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dreams become reality.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en: Saboat M. is 29 years old and lives with her spouse. She works every day, starting very early in the morning so that she can succeed and achieve her goal of having her 2 children successfully finish school and enter University. Her business is located in the central market of Istaravshan town and she sells clothes for women. With the support of her spouse and her own effort, she was able to expand her business. A business that began with little inventory and in a small space, now has much more space with a large clientele. With the loan of 3000 Somoni ($ 900 USD), which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, including a few special requests from her customers.Saboat has the strength and courage to make her business a success and thanks kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing in order to increase the variety of goods for sale.

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six (06) membres du groupe Tièssiri ont un âge moyen de 36ans et vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques avec en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles se sont connues dans l’association traditionnelle (Faïda)  de tontine des femmes du quartier bamanan kin de Kirango créée depuis une dizaine d’année. 
Elles font le commerce de produits cosmétiques, du riz, du savon et des détergents.
Après avoir bien remboursé les prêts précédents, le groupe est à son 4ème prêt pour un montant de 600 000FCFA qui  sera utilisé pour acheter  10 cartons de savons et 20 cartons de 100 sachets d’Omo « barikatigui ». Elles s’approvisionnent en ces produits à la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou. Tous ces produits sont vendus au marché de Kirango et de Diamarabougou   au comptant ou à crédit  à  une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 37 900 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour payer les frais scolaires des enfants. Elles ont pour  ambition d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce afin de diversifier leurs activités commerciales et préparer petit à petit l’avenir des enfants. 
NB : Ami C. est absente de la photo à cause du décès de son enfant. Des voleurs ont assassiné son enfant à Bamako (capitale du Mali).
texts.en:
The six members of the group Tièssiri average 36 years of age and live for the most part in polygamous families with three children on average. The group members know one another from the tontine (Faïda), a traditional association of women, of the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango that was created a dozen years ago. They do commerce in cosmetics, rice, soap, and detergents.

After having repaid the preceding loans, the group is on its fourth loan in the amount of 600,000 francs CFA that will be used to buy: ten boxes of soap and twenty 100-packet boxes of Omo "barikatigui". These goods are gotten at the weekly fair of Diamarabougou and are sold at the Kirango and Diamarabougou markets, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed mostly of women.

The group members intend to realize an average profit of 37,900 francs to be used for paying the schooling costs of the children. Their ambition is to augment their working capital in order to diversify their commerce and to make a future for the children, little by little. Note: Ami C. is absent from the photo because of the death of her child, who was murdered by thieves in Bamako (capital of Mali).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap (in bars and powdered)

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 41 years old and married to Efren.  The couple was blessed with three children: Jhonson – 21 years old; Roxan - 18 years old; college student and the youngest is Peter Jhon P. - 6 years old, a Day Care student.  The family is currently living in Barangay Rizal, Santiago City where most women in the community venture into different micro-enterprise like food vending. 

Perlita is engaged in the food vending business selling different viands.  Aside from food, she is also into the direct selling of personal products for males and females for additional income to support the educational needs of her children.  Her weekly income of PHP2,000.00 contributes a lot in their family.  She wants to improve her vending business and plans to put up a small restaurant in the future for them to have a stable source of income.  In order to do this, she must start now.  She is asking for a loan oh PHP5,000.00 that she will use to make it grow.  
	
“I must work hard for the future of my children” said Perlita. She also said that cooperation of her family is one of the keys in uplifting their living condition out of poverty.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Silvia Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Sonia L. L. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, en el barrio Pacifico, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de superior completa (técnica en industria alimentaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, ella posee un negocio de venta de verduras, gas y abarrotes al por menor, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de mercaderías (verduras) para su negocio. 
Ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, dicho préstamo le servirá como capital para poder adquirir mercaderías para su negocio (tomates, azúcar, frutas, etc.) y tener un negocio surtido, su anhelo es tener su propia casa donde piensa poner una fabrica de maná para el sustento de su hijo y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Sonia L. L. is a member of the Community Bank "Union 28 de Julio," in the Pacifico neighborhood, Yunguyo district, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno; she is 31 years old, married by common law, has one child and a complete high school education (food industry technician). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years, has a business selling vegetables, bas and groceries; her first loan was for S/.300.00 New Soles, which she invested in the purchase of merchandise (vegetables) for her business. She needs an additional loan of S/.1,700 New Soles, which she plans to repay in 3 monthly installments; this loan will be used as capital to buy merchandise (tomatoes, sugar, fruit, etc.) and have a well stocked store. She wishes to own her own home where she can produce homemade candy (mana) to support her family and child.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de mercaderías :tomates,azúcar,frutas,etc

loans.name: Kao

texts.en: From a great smile of the Cambodian citizen, H., 39 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province and is a mother of three children: one is married and lives separately, and the other two are still young. She is married to Tith, 59 years old, who is employed as a fish seller in the market in the morning and late afternoon. H. has been raising piglets in the pigpen behind her house for more than one year. And with her husband, she owns a stall distilling traditional white wine too. The family has improved their standard of living in the village. But recently, Tith is facing difficulty with transportation. So H. is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is the 35-year-old, married mother of three children. All her children are in school. She and her husband operate a licensed chemist's shop in their village. It is Florence's desire to use the proceeds from her business in order to provide a better education for her children.

The pharmacy has been the major source of the family's livelihood for the past ten years. Florence has completed training in the dispensation of prescription drugs, and it is she who is the primary pharmacist for the surrounding villages. Florence has a passion for what she is doing, which is the main reason why people fill their prescriptions from her shop.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase the assorted pharmaceutical drugs that are in the most frequent demand. The pharmacy's prescription drugs are delivered from Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.

Florence is grateful for this support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua,’ which literally means 'God’s family.'

loans.use: For the purchase of pharmaceutical drugs for her chemist's shop.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia S. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family at Bawjiase in the central region, Ghana.

Lydia runs a grocery shop to help her husband support the family. She has been in business for two years now. She sells items such as tins of Milo (malted milk powder), milk, sugar, bread, tinned fish, etc. Lydia procures her goods from wholesalers in the big cities such as Accra.

She wants a loan to expand the size of her shop and also buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her to save more to support her family, especially her kids' education. She belongs to a trust bank group called ‘shining star’. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo L. tiene ya más de cuatro años con su negocio de preparación y venta de productos para la limpieza, es la fuente de ingresos para su familia.
En esté momento le está haciendo falta materia prima para poder preparar los productos que le están solicitando su clientes, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario, portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo y así poder compara la material que necesita y poder entregar los pedido a tiempo, para que sus clientes estén contentos y lo puedan recomendar a otras persona y así sus ingresos mejoraran y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo L. has been preparing and selling clearing products for over four years. This is his source of income for his family. He now lacks the raw materials he needs to prepare the products that his customers are asking for. He does not have the capital he needs. That is why he is asking for a loan, which he will use to buy the necessary materials to be able to deliver his orders on time. Then his customers will be happy, and they can recommend him to other people. This way his income and his family life will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en:
N. Fatuma has been able to pay back her previous loan on time because she was able to put it to good use once she received it. She is a businesswoman with a tailoring business where she makes dresses, skirts, blouses as well as mending those that are already made. She is married with three children and is also caring for two relatives with full responsibility for their welfare.

Fatuma’s weekly income has increased over time, though her business booms mostly during the festive seasons when everyone is in the mood for buying new clothes. She is also a farmer with plantations and cows that all bring in an income. She needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for her business expansion

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw Y. is fifty-six years old. He is divorced and has two children who are currently working.

Yaw enjoys trading. He is a retailer of radios, radio/cassette players and flashlights. He buys his supplies from wholesalers and retails them to his customers. He does door to door sales.

Yaw is handicapped by low working capital. and therefore needs the loan to remain in business. He wants to use the loan to buy more radios, radio/cassette players and flashlights to meet his customers’ demands. He believes this will enable him to make a good income from his business.

loans.use: To more radios, radio/cassette players and flashlights

loans.name: Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is a member of the Tujikomboe borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 48-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 36, 34, 30, and 21.

Zuhura started her own salon business 6 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Zuhura’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 350,000 Tsh in order to expand her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zuhura hopes to save money, to do repairs, improve her home, get more food for her family, and expand her business.

Anitha, the other member of the Tujikomboe borrower group, has also requested 350,000 Tsh in order to support her own business selling maize and rice.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Mrs. Chhorn Ben Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorn B. is a silk weaver in her village. She is 45 years old and the mother of five childrE.: two of tH. are attending the local school while the others are still at home because they are young. Her husband, Mr. Aom Sreav, is a construction worker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave. She hopes to increase her income to improve her living conditions. Mrs. Chhorn B. is the village bank president who has beE. selected by the members.

Twenty people, who all live in Kandal village in Takeo province, make up this village bank. The members will use their loans for different purposes. Eight members in this group have end-of-term loans (the rest have monthly payment loans). They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. They allow tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 41 años, es soltera y madre de 4 hijos, los cuales viven lejos, pero le brindan apoyo desde donde están. Ella es profesora del nivel primario y trabaja desde hace 28 años en una institución educativa. Sin embargo, no es la única actividad a la que se dedica, pues ya que al vivir sola, decidió alquilar las habitaciones vacías que tiene en su casa (hace 8 meses) y también vende cosméticos y ropa desde hace 10 años. Estos productos que los lleva a vender por diferentes lugares durante sus ratos libres y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su labor es sentirse ocupada y olvidarse que está sola, además le es rentable porque sus ingresos son fijos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha notado que existe compañerismo y mucha responsabilidad por parte de todos. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará más productos de belleza y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 41, is a single mother of 4 children who live far away but who send help from where they are. She is a primary school teacher and has been working in an educational institution for 28 years. This, however, is not her only activity, because since she has been living alone, she decided to rent out the empty rooms in her house (for the last 8 months) and she has also been selling cosmetics and clothing for 10 years. During her free time, she brings these products to various places to sell and it has gone very well. What she likes about her work is keeping occupied and forgetting that she is alone, as well as the profit because she is on a fixed income. This is the first time that she has taken a loan through MFP. She enjoys working with her communal bank because she has found companionship and responsibility among all the members. With the money she is requesting, she will buy more beauty products and garments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional merchandise

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 06 hijos y estudio educación primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en la comunidad de Ilata.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de ovinos para engorde, lo vende en las ferias unas veces vivo y otro en carne dependiendo de la temporada, mercedes también realiza la actividad del trueque con productos de la región.

Su mayor deseo es continuar su trabajo y poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr: Mohamed D.  gère un salon de coiffure et de vente de produits cosmétique. Il exerce ce métier depuis plusieurs années. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui ont permis de se marier et d’entretenir sa famille. Pour renforcer son activité, acheter des produits cosmétiques et renouveler son matériel de travail, il sollicite un prêt de l UIMCEC.

loans.use: ACHAT DE PRODUITS

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Victoria” esta representado por la señora Mariela y conformada por 12 miembros, todos radican en la misma zona en la comunidad la Victoria D. donD. proviene su nombre,  esta comunidad se encuentra alejada del centro D. la ciudad donD. la mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la producción D. papa, lechuga, hortalizas y a la elaboración D. pan casero.  En cuanto a la competencia  esta muy elevada pero como su producto D. panificación es muy conocido ellas tienen buenas ventas ya que su producto es muy aceptado por la población a pesar del alza D. precios. El destino del crédito es para el incremento D. insumos para las panaderías y para compra D. semillas para la agricultura en algunos casos para la compra D. amasadoras y mezcladoras automáticas para incrementar mas sus ventas ya que en esta época del año las ventas son mas elevadas y se  esperan que sus negocios  crezcan y obtengan un mayor beneficios para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. A pesar D. ser su primer crédito las socias tienen experiencia en créditos solidarios debido a financiamientos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy P. is from the village of Canubay. She is 39 years old. She is separated and has one infant child. To make a living, Mary Joy owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $65 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mary Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. This will be her third loan from PMPC. Mary Joy plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Simeur

texts.en: Mrs. Simeur N. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Choy Tech Nich, is a laborer who can make a small income. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Simeur N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Simeur N. is the mother of five children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Tserenlham

texts.en:
G. Tserenlham is 49 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Ariuntuya, is 24 years old and works as a secondary school teacher. Tserenlham operates a flour and rice trading business in her town with the help of her husband. She travels to Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital and largest city, once a month to purchase her products, and then transports them back for sale. 

Tserenlham started her business in 2009 after managing a clothing trading business for 6 years. She is a very knowledgeable businesswoman and has much experience managing a small business.  She hopes to grow her business quickly and already has plans for the future. She is a very responsible person and is known for her good character. She says, "I hope to own my own workplace in the future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug ($2,100 USD) loan to purchase flour and rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Roseline is 34 years old. She sells groceries at retail prices to make a living. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.                                                                                                                                                                                                         .

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Risika

texts.en:
Risika is 45 years old, married, and has four children; she lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Risika sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, ground nuts (peanuts), eggs, drinks, etc. She is a focused, hard worker and puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable.

Risika is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you and promise to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband and their five children in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon. Ghada has been selling clothes from her house since 1998. She sells women's clothes, scarves and clothes for veiled women, as well as pajamas and lingerie. 

Ghada decided to start her business because she likes it and has experience. However, when she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Now, Ghada is well known because she does her best to suit her client’s needs. Her clients are women from her region.

She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase more merchandise for her sales. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. 

In the future, she plans to keep on improving her business and to attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva K. is married and has two children. She has completed her senior high school education.  Her husband is a merchant. For some time now, Eva has been selling plastic containers and towels at Abura, near Cape Coast. Eva uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more plastic containers and buckets for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Eva plans to save to reinvest in the business and to further her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic containers and buckets for sale

loans.name: David 5,6 Group

texts.en:
Arisleyda is the coordinator of her group 'David', and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the agricultural communities surrounding L. Romana where the economy is based around the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner.

Arisleyda is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a 'colmado' (general store) by purchasing merchandise to sell such as rice, oil, canned food, and canned soups. She will use the profits to invest in her home which she would like to make bigger in expectation of a child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Oil, rice, sauces, canned food, and canned soups

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón tiene 26 años de edad, vive en concubinato con la Sra. Sandra  quien realiza trabajos de peluquería a domicilio, no tienen hijos, viven en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Itá.
El Sr. Ramón alquila un salón en el  centro de la ciudad donde comercializa teléfonos celulares, carcasas, estuches y realiza servicios de reparación, además vende auto radios, parlantes, Twisters, cornetas, cajas y realiza equipamiento de vehículos hace 3 años.  
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mas artículos para equipamiento de vehículos, en esta ocasión desea realizar sus compras de Ciudad del Este ya que allí estos artículos tienen un costo muy bajo lo cual le generará mayor margen de ganancia en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ramón is 26 years old and lives with Sandra, who cuts hair in people’s homes. They have no children and live in a well-known Itá neighborhood. Ramon rents a shop in the city center where he sells cellular phones, chargers, holsters, and performs repairs. He also sells car radios, sound equipment, Twisters, horns, and boom boxes. He has been selling car equipment for the past three years. He is requesting this loan to buy more automobile equipment. This time he would like to buy his items in “Ciudad del Este” since they are inexpensive there and this provides him a better margin.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jessica Paola

texts.es:
Jessica S. es otra socia activa hace dos años del Banco Comunal  San Pablo   ubicado a unos 10 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad Rumiloma,  su gente se dedica principalmente a la  agricultura y ganadería mientras que los jóvenes migran a otras ciudades dentro y fuera del país en busca de  mejores oportunidades.

Jessica tiene 23 años de edad es casada y en su vida conyugal ha concebido  una hija que se encuentra de 4 años, su esposo es sastre de  profesión, aún no tienen casa propia al momento  viven  en casa de su suegra pero de manera independiente.


Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de pollos los que luego vende en la Feria Libre o entrega a sus clientes en su comunidad,  realiza esta actividad hace dos años y es un apoyo para salir adelante con su familia también cría chanchos y tiene una vaca. Con el nuevo crédito que realiza va adquirir pollos y chanchos, alimento  para seguir con su negocio, su meta es de llegar a construir su casa y ampliar su negocio para así llegar a tener una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Jessica S. has been an active member of the San Pablo Communal Bank for two years. The bank is located on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. It is ten minutes away in the Rumiloma community. The people generally work in farming and livestock. The young people migrate to other cities within and outside of the country. They are looking for better opportunities. Jessica is 23 and married. They have a four year old daughter. Her husband is a tailor by profession. They do not have their own house, and for the moment they live in her mother-in-law’s house. But, they live in an independent way. She raises chickens, and then she sells them in the Feria Libre or she delivers them to her customers in her community. She has been doing this for two years. It helps her family get ahead. She also raises pigs, and she has a cow. With the new loan she will get chickens, pigs, and food to continue her business. Her goal is to build her house and to expand her business. That way she will come to have greater economic solvency.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, pigs, and food for them in order to raise them and sell them

loans.name: Haph

texts.en:
Mrs. S., age 40, has lived with her five family members for years in a medium-sized wooden house along the village road of the province of Siem Reap.

S. and her husband currently make their daily income by fishing around the river, earning $5 each day. The family always hurries to leave home when the sky is still dark, to go to the river where they collect some fishes from their traps. Then they bring the fish to retail in the market for a profit.

Currently, the quantity of fish caught is declining due to a lack of fishing accessories. This is why S. has requested a loan in order to purchase more equipment to use when fishing.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing equipment

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
A very determined and hardworking lady, D. Charity, aged 28 years, has been in the education sector for four years. She is a single mother with one child undergoing nursery school.

This loan is to help Charity buy household items that include chairs and mattresses and cater for her family basic needs in order to improve on her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase household items like matresses, saucepans and a bed

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier González tiene una vivienda de interés social la cual quiere ir haciéndole reparaciones para que este en mejores condiciones. El crédito que solicita es para pintar las paredes por dentro y por fuera, también el desea levantar una barda en la parte de atrás del patio para dividir la casa del vecino y así no tener problemas en un futuro. Francisco y su esposa son personas trabajadora que la mayor parte del día se la pasan en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisco has a home that he would like to renovate so that it is in better condition. With the loan that he is requesting he would paint the walls inside and outside. He would also like to erect a fence in the backyard in order to separate his home from the neighbor’s property. In this way he would avoid any potential problems with the neighbors. Francisco and his wife are hard workers that spend most of the day working at their jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his home

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth G. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 35 years old. Maribeth is married. To make a living, Maribeth owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Maribeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Maribeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 45 years old. Ruben is single. To make a living, Ruben raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ruben has been engaged in his business for over 15 years. Ruben joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruben has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ruben is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and gas for the tractor he used. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Ruben from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it. About CEVI Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and gas for the tractor he used

loans.name: Jacinto Andrés

texts.es:
Jacinto Andrés J. P. tiene 42 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. No Tiene  hijo. 

Jacinto es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Jacinto se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maiz.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en el Mercado de Chillanes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener mejor ingreso económico para superarse en la vida. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Jacinto Andrés J. P., 42, is a single man living in the canton of Chillanes, Bolivar Province, Recinto precinct. He has no children. Jacinto is a member of the rural group La Delicia Recinto Progress that is part of the San José del Tambo parish. This group consists of 19 members who grow cacao and corn. Jacinto does agricultural work growing corn. He makes his monthly purchases of products and supplies for planting through the Agro services of AGRIPAD, and sells his products in the Chillanes Market. He is requesting this loan to purchase supplies of corn. He believes that his loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have a better income in order to better his life. The challenges he faces are the weather and the lack of economic resources. He would like to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 56 años, vive con  su hija en su casa propia. Vende comida desde hace 4 años, desde entonces cocina todas las mañanas en su casa y  los lleva al centro educativo que queda cerca de su casa, en donde los profesores y alumnos son los que consumen su deliciosa sazón. Es así que se genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su hija. Siempre disfruta de su trabajo porque le gusta cocinar, además que le ayuda cubrir los gastos educativos de su hija, que ya es universitaria. Afirma que este negocio es rentable y siempre esta dispuesta a continuar trabajando, en adelante desea tener un restaurante grande. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de sus alimentos como arroz por sacos, menestras, azúcar y fideos.
texts.en:
Esther is 56 and lives with her daughter in her own home. She's been selling food for the past 4 years. Every morning since then she cooks at home and then takes it to a nearby school where teachers and students enjoy her delicious food. This is how she makes a living to support her daughter. She enjoys her work because she likes to cook and because it helps pay for her daughter's university education. She says the business is profitable and she is willing to keep working, hoping to have a large restaurant in the future. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know she has financial support. She has always been punctual with her payments and is happy to be a part of the community group since all the other members are responsible and supportive. She is thankful to all those people who will help with the loan since it will be very useful for her business. She will use the loan to buy basic ingredients for her food such as: rice in bulk, vegetable stew sugar and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Burzu

texts.ru:
Burzu A. pereselenec iz Fuzuli, i seychas on projivayet v Fuzuli regione ,< Behmenli village>. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey , sinu 14 let on uchitsya v shkole, dochke 18 let ona uchitsya v universitete i sinu 19 let  on toje uchitsya v universitete i takje xodit na muziku. 

Eto vtoroy ssud Burzu , v perviy raz on bral dengi chto bi kupit  dlya svoyeqo kafe . on ochen blaqodaren Kive za ssudu.

Burzu 2 qoda tomu nazad reshil zanatya jivotnavodstvom. I teper on nujdayetsya  v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit novix < calves>. On pokupayet malenkix  potom virostiv ix  on prodayet ix maso.
texts.en:
Burzu A. is a refugee from Fuzuli who currently lives in Behmenli village in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has three children. His fourteen-year-old son goes to school. His daughter is eighteen and studies at the university. His nineteen-year-old son also studies at the university as well as studying music. This is Burzu’s second loan. The first time, he took money to buy supplies for his café. He is very thankful to Kiva for the loan. Two years ago, Burzu decided to work in animal husbandry. Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy new calves. He buys them small, then raises them and sells their meat.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Daniel; el tiene 63 años de edad y es casado;  tiene 2 hijos y  el socio se dedica a administrar su tienda abarrotes, el trabaja en su tienda desde hace 9 años; el socio solicita para hacer de este un nuevo capital de trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en  la implementación de su tienda abarrotes.        

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Daniel, 63, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE CHAPI” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. He is married, has two children and has had a grocery store for the last 9 years. He needs capital to buy stock items for the store. He is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie Q. is from the village of Pobalcion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old. Freddie is single. To make a living, Freddie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Freddie is also a security guard.Freddie has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Freddie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Freddie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Freddie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Freddie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 28 years old. Irene is married and has three children aged 8, 5 and 2. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling bamboo products in the local community. She also raises pigs and chickens and hopes to acquire more livestock to raise.

Irene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Irene is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase bamboo, piglets and chickens. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboos, piglets, and chickens

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: Lupe tiene 39 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en casa D. sus padres. DesD. hace 1 año se dedica a L. venta D. leña así como a L. venta D. panes, es así que logra afrontar los costos D. su hogar. DesD. entonces se levanta D. madrugada para vender pan, ni bien salen del horno los distribuye a las bodegas D. su comunidad, es por ello que día a día se esfuerza en elaborar pan D. calidad al gusto D. sus clientes. Asimismo dentro D. esta actividad contrata a una persona que sabe preparar L. masa, mientras elL. se encarga D. terminar el proceso, D. esa manera termina D. hornear L. cantidad D. pan que al día se venD.. En cuanto a L. venta D. leña compra por troncos, en el que los manda a cortar para luego ser vendidos; generalmente esta venta lo realiza los fines D. semana. Lo que más anheL. es mejorar su panificadora, para ello necesitara D. maquinarias más sofisticadas y pueda elaborar pan en corto tiempo y en cantidad. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que L. consideran como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias. Agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. troncos al por mayor y para que pueda incrementar su capital D. trabajo y poder establecerse en este negocio.
texts.en:
Lupe, 39, lives with her three children in her parents’ house.  For the last year she has sold firewood as well as bread; this is how she meets household expenses.  

She rises at dawn to sell bread to stores in her area as soon as it comes out of the oven; she works hard to produce quality bread for her customers’ enjoyment.  She hires a person who knows how to prepare the dough while she finishes the rest of the process thereby making just the right amount of bread she sells daily.

With respect to the firewood sales, she buys tree trunks that she has cut for subsequent sale.  These sales are usually done on the weekend.

Her greatest wish is to improve her bakery; to do so she needs more sophisticated machinery to bake the bread in quantity and more quickly.

This is her 8th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she’s considered to be a responsible person with respect to repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are mutually supportive.

She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting because it will be very useful for the progress of her business.

She will use the requested loan to buy tree trunks at wholesale in order to increase her working capital and become established in this type of business.

loans.use: To buy tree trunks to make firewood.

loans.name: Rath

texts.en: Rath S., 25 years old, is a humble people living in the capital, Phnom Penh. She is married and blessed with two young school-aged children, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. To earn a living, Rath S. operates the small business in her house by opening Karaoke room for people around her community who wish to sing a song. Rath S. said that most income come from her husband’s business. She said that her husband’s motorbike often has broken down during use. Because of that, Rath S. has decided to seek a loan of $1,200 from Kiva, which she will use to buy new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily L. is from the village of Bangko,Pana-on,Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Emily is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling  noodles, sugar, canned goods, shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other daily use products in the local community. Emily is just starting this business.

In 2008, Emily joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Emily is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Emily from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en: Cuc C. T. (109) is a 50-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Cuc is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh (030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh). Cuc is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Cuc operates a family member's business cultivating fruit trees and harvesting fruit for saL.. Cuc has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2005, Cuc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cuc has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 7th loan taken out by her from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cuc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Binh B. T. (131) is a 34 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Huong L. T. (104) is a 47 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. Cai T. T. (71) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Ha L. T. (60) is a 40 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. Dinh N. T. (56) is a 38 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Cuc C. T. (109) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa. Cuc là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh (030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng cây ăn trái & thu hoạch trái để bán. Cuc thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 11 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Cuc kiếm được khoảng 5,000,000 VND. Vào 2005, Cuc đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Cuc đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua hạt giống bổ sung, cây giống & cây con để trồng. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Binh B. T. (131) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Huong L. T. (104) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Cai T. T. (71) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Ha L. T. (60) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Dinh N. T. (56) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is a married woman who lives in Prk.Kabugwasan, Brgy.Zone 3, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one  business venture: a charcoal and firewood sales business.  Her husband Rogelio, who is 55 years old, works as a truck driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are 20 to 32 years old.

 Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use to buy additional stock of charcoal and firewood to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

 Erlinda E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy the construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To build up her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 49 year-old Hawa M.. She is married and has 4 children ages 6, 9, 12 and 15. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they help with her business. In 2000, Hawa established her drinks business where she sells soft drinks and safe drinking water. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband. Working six days a week and six hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now would like a second loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Hawa plans to open a bigger shop and hire a sales person. She is very determined.

loans.use: Buy more drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua M. is married to a driver. She has been through junior high school.  Ekua sells hair and skin products at Abbrem Agona, which is near Abura in Cape Coast, where she has been for three years. Ekua is requesting the loan to purchase more hair and skin products for resale. She plans to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: purchase more hair and skin products for resale

loans.name: Urinboy

texts.en:
S. Urinboy is 39 years old and married with two children. Urinboy is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming and has now acquired fair experience in agriculture. Urinboy is very happy because his children are the motivation for his desire to develop his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more seeds and fertilizer to sow for a good harvest and to take care of his children and his home.   
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has one son. She owns a small business that sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for fifteen years. She has always offered high quality products and excellent client service. She has many repeat clients that make her business a success. Irina has an active life that encourages her business neighbors and friends. 

Irina has used micro-loans before and found them very helpful. This time, she would like to borrow 20,000 Grivnas to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and receive additional income to take better care of her family as well as help her son pay for college.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of coats for resale

loans.name: Maria Celestina

texts.es:
Doña Maria Celestina C. M., señora casada, tiene 35 años de edad, ha cursado la educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales estudian, se dedica a la artesanía (elaboración de cintas típicas), tiene ya 18 años de realizar este trabajo, aprendió el oficio con un familiar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo como capital, para comprar hilo materia prima del trabajo que realiza, espera que por medio del prestamo mejorar su negocio y su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Celestina C. M. is a 35 year-old married lady who completed her elementary school education.  She has two children who are in school.  Maria is in the handicraft business (she makes traditional belts).  She has been in this line of work for 18 years, having learned the trade from a family member.  She has the support of her husband who is a construction worker. 

Maria is requesting a loan to use as capital to buy yarn which is raw material for the work that she carries out.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve her business and her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy yarn for weaving traditional belts

loans.name: Maria Eduarda

texts.es: La señora Maria Eduarda cuenta con 38 años, es madre de 4 hijos.  Su actividad es la venta de tortillas, hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio por lo que ha sido una actividad muy humilde. Eduarda es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta de obtener este medio de vida. Inicio este negocio con la ayuda de sus esposo, pues lograron observar que es un negocio rentable la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos, con la buena calidad de sus productos. Este crédito es para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, bolsas, comal, entre otros productos. Sueña con llegar a preparar a sus hijos y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en: Eduarda Maria is 38 years old and mother of 4 children.  She sells tortillas and has been in the business for more than 9 years; it has been a humble profession.  Eduarda is a very responsible woman and enjoys her current lifestyle.  She began her business with the help of her husband.  They observed that it is a viable business and the majority of their clients are satisfied with the good quality of their products.  This loan is for the purchase of corn, lime, firewood, bags, and a griddle amongst other things.  She dreams of preparing her children to be good people.

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, firewood, bags, and a griddle amongst other things.

loans.name: Lidia Azucena

texts.es: Lidia es una mujer responsable se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Tiene más de 11 años  en este medio de vida. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos pues ella busca la forma de complacerlos por medio de los financiamientos.  Sus hijos son cuatro y son menores de edad ellos todavía están a su cargo. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de camarones, pescado, punches, jaibas,  chuletas entre otros.
