texts.en: Lidia is a responsible woman who sells seafood. She has been doing this for more than 11 years. The majority of her clients always ask for a great variety of products and so she's looking for a way to make them happy through the loans. She has four young children who are still in her care. The purpose of the loan is to buy shrimp, fish, crabs and fillets among other things.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish, crabs, and fish fillets, among other things

loans.name: Natividad Adán

texts.es: Natividad Adán G. M. de 50 años de edad, habita en su casa en el Municipio de San Miguel Tepezontes del Departamento de La paz. Él posee una tienda en su hogar de residencia la cual ha tenido durante mucho tiempo. Es un hombre trabajador que lucha día a día para salir adelante y poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es ver su tienda abastecida y contar con lo necesario para que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan. Para él lo más importante son sus clientes siempre se preocupa por brindarles el mejor servicio y de hacerlos sentir que son importantes, de esta forma ha logrado una clientela muy grande y  cada día le demandan más sus productos. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito para tener la capacidad de comprar variedad de productos para tienda tales como: arroz, azúcar, golosinas, pan dulce, aceite, papel, detergentes y todo lo necesario para mantener surtida su tiendita y lograr incrementar sus ventas y así poder obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Natividad Adán G. M., 50, lives in his house in the town of San Miguel Tepezontes, La Paz Department.  He has a home based store that he’s had for a long time.  He is a hard working man who struggles daily to get ahead and improve his quality of life.

His dream is to see that his store is well stocked and to have everything necessary so that his customers can always find what they are looking for.  For him, his customers are the most important thing and he strives to provide the best service and make them feel important.  This has led to him gaining a large clientele that every day increases their demand for his products.  

This has impelled him to request a loan in order to be able to buy a variety of items for the store like: rice, sugar, snacks, pastries, oil, paper, detergent and everything necessary to have his small store stocked to increase sales and reach higher profits that will lead to an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice sells beans and groundnuts. She is 43 years old and a widow with ten children. None of her children attend school. Rejoice borrowed a loan to stock more beans and groundnuts to sell. With extra profits, she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis, tiene la edad de 52 años, está casado, el  vive con  su esposa y sus 3  hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su cafetal para así poder obtener mejores ganancias. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación del cultivo y esta ya sembrado de café. El pretende abonarlo y asistirlo para así obtener mejores producciones  más altas y generar las ganancias para el bienestar de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 52 years old and married.   He lives with his wife and three children who are his main priority in life.  He plans to use this loan to care for his coffee plantation so that he can make better profits.  He has a suitable plot of land for growing crops and it is already sown with coffee.  He plans to add fertilizers and care for his crops so that he can obtain a better, higher yield and make the profits he needs to take care of his family's well-being.

This is Jorge Luis' first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have provided him this loan with better repayment facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his coffee crop

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Teresa has a retail shop from which she sells fish like sardines, milk fish and mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional fish like sardines & milk fish.

Teresa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish like sardines & milk fish.

loans.name: Koudjoukalou

texts.fr: Mariée à un revendeur  et maman de 06 enfants, Koudjoukalou a 29ans et elle réside à Agoé.  En 2010, elle a ouvert dans son domicile une boutique où elle vend des produits de premières nécessités (sucre, riz, huile végétale). Elle désire voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions. Ce premier  prêt l’aidera à acheter afin de répondre à la demande de ses nombreux clients. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de Lomé.
texts.en: Koudjoukalou is married to a merchant and the mother of six children. She is 29 years old and lives in Agoé. In 2010, she opened a store in her home where she sells basic products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil). She wants to see her children grow up with a stable family background. This is her first loan; it will help her to buy some inventory and meet the demand of her many customers. She gets her supplies at the market in Lomé.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés, tiene la edad de 31 años, está en unión libre y vive con su señora esposa. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de una siembra de café que realizo. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado y está en muy buenas condiciones por lo que quiere asistirlo para tener mejores rendimientos cuando coseche por primera vez. El pretende generar las ganancias para salir adelante con su proyecto nuevo y salir con las pagos de su crédito. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Andres is 31 years old, married common-law, and he lives with his wife. He plans on purchasing necessary products to maintain the coffee plantation he has started. He has an already-sown farm land which is in very good conditions. He wants to maintain it to have a better yield during the first-time harvest. He plans on generating a profit to move forward with his project and to make his loan payments. It is the first loan he receives from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had previous loans with state banks, but Fudecosur has provided him with a loan with greater ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Mary has a water refilling station that sells and refills drinking water. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to pay for the utilities spent during delivery of water containers.

Mary is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the utilities spent during delivery of water containers.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Yolanda nació en la ciudad de Huyro de la provincia de la Convención (Cusco, Perú), tiene 37 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en un local alquilado y donde atiende a sus clientes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta  las 10 de la noche de lunes a viernes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Yolanda requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de azúcar, fideos, arroz, etc. El sueño de Yolanda es abrir otra tienda de abarrotes pero que un local se ha propio.
texts.en:
The “El Molinito II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, commerce and for its traditional, Inti Raymi, festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

Yolanda was born in the city of Huyro in La Convención Province, (Cusco, Perú).  She is 37 years old and has two children.  She currently lives in the city of Cusco where she carries out her economic activities.  

She has a grocery store in a rented space where she tends to her customers Monday through Friday from 6am until 10pm.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well.  On this occasion, Yolanda needs the loan to buy sacks of sugar, noodles, rice, etc.  Yolanda’s dream is to open another grocery store but in a locale of her own.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, noodles, rice, etc.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia tiene 46 años, casado con Obaldo de 44 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Teodosia es una mujer muy laboriosa, que desde muy niña tuvo que trabajar por ganarse la vida y lograr tener un futuro. Al ver que ella era considerada dentro de su barrio como una de las personas más participativa en las actividades, aprovecho para instalar un negocio que es la venta de pollos, claro que a los inicios le fue muy difícil mantener en pie su negocio, pero con el tiempo logro confianza y habilidad en la venta. El único problema que tiene es que los pollos debe comprarlos en la ciudad de San Francisco que queda a 30 kilómetros, por lo que continuamente debe trasladarse para así abastecerse de capital de trabajo. Este es su primer  crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 soles que solicita, comprará más pollos.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 46 years old and married to Obaldo, age 44. They have six children and live in their own home in the District of Llochegua. Teodosia is a hardworking woman who has been earning a livelihood since she was a young girl so that she could have a future. She is regarded in her neighborhood as one of the most active people because of her business activities. Teodosia took the opportunity to start a business selling chickens. Maintaining her business was very difficult at the beginning, but over time she gained confidence in her sales ability. The only problem she deals with is having to buy chickens in the city of San Francisco, which is 30 kilometers away. She must travel constantly in order to stock up on inventory.

This is her first loan with MFP and Teodosia promises to submit her payments on time. The loan of 1500 PEN will be used to buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for butchering.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando, tiene la edad de 50 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos del almacigo y realizar el pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento del almacigo. El tiene sembrado un almacigo de café para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad y a productores que quieran aumentar el tamaño de su cafetal. el pretende con esto darle a su almacigo los mejores cuidados para así vender buena calidad y generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Orlando is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children who are his main priority.  With this loan, he will buy supplies for a seedbed and pay laborers to maintain the seedbed.  He has sown a bed with coffee which he will later sell in the town market and to producers who want to increase the size of their coffee plantations.  Orlando plans to give his seedbed the very best care so that he can sell good-quality products and make a lot of profits to provide for his family's well-being.

This is the first loan that Orlando has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't taken out previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedbed supplies.

loans.name: Cairoding

texts.en:
Cairoding is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
 
Cairoding provides motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for maintenance.

Cairoding has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Cairoding hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old, married and thankful for having three children. 

Her family is her motivational guide, and she works hard to give them a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income and will allow her to support her children and extended family.

She has had a retail store based in their home for four years. The daily net profit of 500 PHP is just enough to cover the cost of the family's daily meals. Thus she is thankful for having other sources of income aside from retailing: She also has raised pigs for 10 years.
 
To improve her income in the store, Gloria is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients. She will also buy feed and vaccine for her pigs. Gloria says the loan will be very helpful in the success of her businesses.

loans.use: to buy stock such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients and also feed and vaccine for the  pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chorizo and cheese.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is 28 years old and married with two children between the ages 1 and 8 years old. Janviere owns a business selling various goods such as soap, pads, rice, cosmetics etc. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 8 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her.

Janviere has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more goods such as cosmetics, soap, pads, rice etc to sell. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, pads, rice, cosmetics etc.

loans.name: Davud

texts.ru: On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Davud 43 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Davud uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Davud ochen lubit jivotnix a takje svoyu rabotu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelichesniya kolichestva skota.
texts.en: Davud is married and has two children.  He is 43 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives with his wife and children in the Fuzuli region.  Davud has been involved in animal husbandry for seven years and breeds cattle.  He loves his animals and his work.  Currently, Davud needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase his livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ruth Muthoni

texts.en:
Ruth, a 42 year old married woman, has three children ranging in age from 4 to 15 years. Describing herself as ambitious, honest and faithful, Ruth has been renting out houses for 10 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre in the town of Nakuru, and she has many clients, her biggest business challenge being those who don't make their payments.

Ruth will use the Kes 20,000 loan to renovate and improve the rental houses. Her business goal is to add more rental houses within the next five years.

loans.use: to improve and renovate her rental facilities.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is engaged in agriculture. He has been in this business for more than 30 years and during this period has created his sustainable farm. Because of unfavorable climate conditions this year, Andranik hasn't got enough harvest to sell in the winter. So he plans to purchase more fruits to keep in the freezer and sell. 

With the requested loan, Andranik also plans to purchase seeds to cultivate the land. This loan will allow Andranik to get enough income to meet his family's needs. Andranik lives together with his wife and son.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and seeds.

loans.name: Jitegemee B Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of the Jitegemee B group. Martin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had a good maize yield harvesting 6 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Martin was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Faalili

texts.en:
Faalili is 37-years-old and is married with 5 children.

Faalili owns & operates a business venture, selling breadfruit products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Faalili needs a loan of WST $1200 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to help with her children`s education.

Faalili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faalili's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is 22 years old and single. She sells different foodstuffs such as cooking oil, rice and peanuts, a business which she has been running for the period of one year. With the loan, she will add more items for her shop, and she expects to use the profits to build a house. She dreams to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en:
Kimly, 47, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

He is a staffer in an agricultural company. His wife is a rice farmer. Two of his children are garment workers. 

In order to improve his family's living conditions, Kimly is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to pay for his children's passport fees. By doing so, he will enable his children to legally seek jobs in Thailand to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his youngest child to study through college.

loans.use: to pay for his children's passport fee to go to find jobs in Thailand.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es ex integrante de comité de mujeres, ella está casada, y tiene hijos todos ya mayores de edad.
Elena se dedica, junto con su marido a la compra – venta de ropas, zapatos, carteras y otros accesorios en su propia casa y en la zona de la terminal de ómnibus de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellos trabajan arduamente para poder seguir cubriendo los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa.
Solicitó el crédito para comprar zapatos, carteras, ropas y demás tipo de productos, lo que le podrá ayudar a tener más productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elena is an ex-member of the women’s committee.  She’s married and has children who are all now adults.

Elena and her husband are merchants.  They buy and sell clothes, shoes, purses and other accessories at home and in the area around the city of Santaní’s bus terminal.  They work hard to continue to cover household costs that arise daily.

She requested the loan to buy shoes, purses, clothes and other types of products which will help her have more products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes, purses, clothes and other types of products.

loans.name: Dababougou Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Dababougou Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz  avec    FANTA K. ,  1ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes. 
NB : AIYA, est absente de la photo pour raison sociale.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Dababougou Benkadi 1" are married women averaging 38 years of age and five children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with FANTA K., the first one standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.75 hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 195,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

Note: AIYA is absent from the photo due to societal reasons.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Grace Njeri

texts.en: Grace is 48 years old and has 6 children. Grace has lived in Kware slum area for over 30 years. In 2005, Kajiado county council allocated the Kware plots to the residents who had lived in that area for many years and had built small semi permanent homes. Grace is one among the lucky ones who benefited from this good gesture. Grace has built a house for her family  in this plot and has also put up 11 small semi-permanent rooms which she rents at USD 7 per room. Grace wants to build better rooms that can fetch USD 14.7. This means that her income will increase, thus she will have no difficulty in repaying her loan. To supplement her rental income, she has rented a two acre farm where she grows Maize, beans and peas. She sells the produce at Soko Mjinga market in Rongai assisted by her two daughters. After selling the produce she gives them part of the income. In this way her daughters are able to cater for some of their needs.

loans.use: Grace would like to build permanent rental rooms.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio has created a very interesting business. His product, which he sells at grocery and stationery stores, consists of numbered boxes containing toys and prizes. Children buy a ticket with a number and receive a box containing a suprise gift, which may be a toy, sweets, or balloons. The surprise is the fun part of the game. Antonio would like to extend his business to other cities and manufacture more surprise boxes, for which he is requesting a loan of $1200, which he plans to repay within one year.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Antonio ha emprendido un negocio muy interesante que vende en las tiendas de abarrotes o papelerias, sobre un carton pega un jugete o premio el cual va numerado, los niños compran un boleto con un numero y el numero que sale es el premio asignado, que generalmente son juguetes o dulces o hasta balones, lo cual es una sorpresa y lo interesante del juego, ahora Antonio quiere expanderse a otras ciudades y elaborar mas cartones sorpresa por lo que solicita un credito de $1200.00 Dllrs los cuales piensa pagar en 1 año.

loans.use: To buy supplies and toys

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena A. is in her active years, and her business is making and selling fast food.

Yasaki Samoa Company Limited is the number one industry that employs lots of Samoan people. This is the best place where most of the ladies with this kind of business prefer to sell their food because it’s good.

Matalena is one of those ladies, and she sells food for five dollars a plate.

Matalena is a mother of four children, and this is the source of money to finance their school and family activities.

loans.use: To buy chicken leg quarters, onions, peppers, sausages, bananas, plastic plates, tomato sauce, soy sauce and cucumbers.

loans.name: Laxmi Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi Devi M., 30 years old, is a shopkeeper who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal. She lives in a single family with her husband and two children, a son and a daughter.
Her husband, Krishna M. is a cook and her son is in grade 7 and a daughter is in grade 6. She opens her tea shop 5 years ago. In Nepal tea is preferred by all and demand for tea is increasing day by day. She is selling tea in local area since early morning to evening. 
She seeks $375 to purchase necessary goods for her shop like tables and chairs. She plans to repay the loan on monthly basis. She wants to earn more and more to increase the status of her family among her relatives and friend circles.

loans.use: To Buy tables and chairs for her shop

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mrs. Mok C. sells vegetables at a busy market to support her entire family. She is 57 years old, a widow, and has four children. Her only son works with her in the market. They earn around $5 each day. Her other children are married and live with their own families.

Mrs. Mork C. humbly requests a loan to purchase more vegetables to fulfill the needs of a growing number of custormers, and to buy a motorcycle to help transport vegetables to the market. (This is a picture of Mrs. Mok C.'s son.)

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables to meet needs of growing number of customers.

loans.name: Lameeka

texts.en: Lameeka is 49 years old and married with 4 children of his own and 3 orphans. He is the owner of Basalamala Timber Buyers. He has been in business for 5 years. He is one of three people who own a timber business in the area. He has a good market, since a lot of people are putting up structures in this rural area. He would like to one day acquire another timber store in Kampala to expand his business. For now, he plans to use a loan to add a machine for cutting timber and to buy some more trees. He is a very mature man who is well known in his community. He has had loans before and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase machinery to cut trees and to buy more trees

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
15 years ago Lydia O. decided to start selling palm oil at the Obuasi Market. Since then she has become one of the most popular palm oil sellers at the market. She has good relationships with her customers. Palm oil is a red and flavorful cooking oil. It used in many traditional Ghanaian dishes, such as red-red, fu-fu soup, and palava sauce.

Lydia will be using the loan to purchase palm oil in bulk. This will decrease her costs significantly. Eventually Lydia hopes to build up enough capital to become a palm oil wholesaler.

Lydia is a member of the lending group in the Obuasi market. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount

loans.use: To purchase palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Mrs. Rossana F. is 26 years of age, single, and lives with her parents. Her siblings are all married and work in Argentina.

She started knitting traditional bedspreads and hammocks with her mother when she was only 8 years old. She has been selling her merchandise in the capital city of Asunción for 5 years because it is quite lucrative to do so. Thanks to both her hard work and her savings, she was able to buy a motorcycle, which is her main means of transportation for selling her hammocks and bedspreads.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise such as hammocks, blankets, sashes, and bed sheets because her clients have ordered these products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra Rossana F., tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y es la única que vive con sus padres, ya que sus otros hermanos trabajan en Argentina y todos están casados.

Ella empezó desde los 8 años a tejer con su mamá la tradicional sobrecamas y hamacas que su mamá vendía por la zona. Desde hace 5 años ella vende sus mercaderías en la capital (ciudad de Asunción) ya que le resulta más rentable. Gracias a su trabajo y ahorro pudo comprar una motocicleta que es su principal movilidad para llevar y ofrecer sus hamacas y sobrecamas.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.

loans.use: Purchase of hammocks, bedspreads, sashes, and sheets

loans.name: Juan Filiberto

texts.es:
Juan Filberto is an elderly gentleman with a business that sells all types of products, such as rice, beans, oil, garlic, soap, toilet paper, etc. In essence, it's a small general food store that is located at a self-owned shop in the interior of the municipal market of Chichigalpa.

Due to the difficult economic situation he has experienced for a long time and his low income, Mr. Filiberto finds himself with the obligation of bettering his life's conditions. For this, he needs to invest in purchasing new products that are demanded by the public.

Aware of his family's needs, and considering he is the sole provider of the household, he decided to turn to Ceprodel, which has helped him with loans that he has used to acquire new products to sell at the municipal market of his city. His credit record consists of 19 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Filiberto es un caballero de edad avanzada y con un negocio de venta de todo tipo de productos entre ellos arroz, frijoles, aceite, ajos, jabón papel higiénico, etc. En fin es una pequeña mini pulpería que la ubica en un local propio en lo interno del mercado municipal de Chichigalpa.

Debido a la difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha pasado el señor Filiberto y por los bajos ingresos que obtiene en su negocio, se ha visto en la obligación de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y para esto necesita invertir en la compra de nuevos productos que sean demandados por la población.

Consiente de la necesidad que atraviesa su familia siendo él sustento único de su hogar decide recurrir a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado para adquirir nuevos productos y ofertarlos en el mercado municipal de su ciudad. Su record crediticio es de 19 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel S. is a single nineteen year old business man. He began his business by selling chocolates and other goodies as a traveling salesman. Now, he has expanded his merchandise and is selling backpacks and other school supplies.

Daniel’s big dream is to continue with his schooling while expanding his business into a small store. Someday he hopes to have a family, a business in a central location, and a good income. He will invest the requested loan in school supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy backpacks, notebooks, brushes, and paints.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 45 years old. He is married and has 4 children. One of them is studying at university. He lives in a rented house and has a small shop for clothing sales. He applied to get $1200 to purchase new clothes with new clothes hangers. He also wants to renovate the shop, expand the area, and make advertising in order to increase his income and save for a better future for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new clothes with new clothes hangers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 35-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband. She started her fruit and vegetable stand in 1999. Her hard work, determination and outstanding people skills explain her success, and the fact that her profits now pay her household expenses. Margaret plans to use the funds from her latest loan to increase her income by expanding her grocery business and buying cereals in bulk .

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Expand her grocery business and buy cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena is married and has 2 children ages 11 and 8 years old respectively. She started her business in 2006 when she was able to get a stand at the open-air market and a husband's friend sold her a pack of American clothes. She needed the money for her family's expenses since with her husband's salary it was not enough. He works as clerk at a store where they sell paints. Presently, she is doing very well with her business

She needs a US $250 loan which she will pay back in 6 months. She will buy merchandise with it since right now is a good season to sell clothes and she wants to take advantage of it. With your help, Lorena will be able to increase her business

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Lorena estaa casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años. Inició su negocio en el 2006 cuando consiguio un puesto en el tianguis y un amigo de su esposo le vendio una paca de ropa americana. Ella necesitaba dinero para los gastos de su familia, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente, el trabaja como empleado en una tienda donde comercializan pinturas. Actualmente le hadio muy bien con su negocio.

Ella neecsita un credito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia ya que esta temporada es muy buena para la venta de ropa y desea aprovecharla. Con tu ayuda Lorena podra hcer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock a small clothes selling business.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela is married and has 2 kids her son is 5 years old and her daughter is 2 years old. She started her business 3 years ago; she wanted to help her husband who works as a driver with the expenses at home. She started selling bed sheets by catalogue, currently she wants to stock bed sheets to offer a larger variety to her clients and have some available so she can be faster supplying and won’t have to wait until the bed sheets are sent.

She needs a loan of $250 that she will pay in 3 months to buy the merchandise. With your help she will achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela es casada y tien 2 hijos un niño de 5 años y una niña de 2. Ella incio su negocio hace 3 años, deseaba de alguna manera ayudar con los gastos a su esposo quien es chofer y comenzó a vender colchas y sabanas por catalogo, actualmente quiere tener un stock de colchas para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y tener disponibles algunas a fin de ser mas rápido el surtido y no esperar hasta el envió de las colchas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia.Con tu apoyo ella lograra sus objetivos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Hawa's Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.en:
Hawa, 38, is married with four children, age 20, 15, 11, and 6. She has been a clothes (vitenge) and bites salesperson since 2006. She works from 6AM to 5PM each day and earns a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Hawa is requesting a loan to buy more items to increase her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mariam, who also has a business dealing with bites and juice sales.

loans.use: To increase the current inventory for higher sales.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Née en 1957, A. Véronique est une femme divorcée avec 5 enfants à charge. Elle fait le commerce de légumes, du poisson fumé et divers. Malgré sa bonne volonté, elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle  fautes de moyens financiers. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour consolider son activité et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et réaliser des économies afin de pouvoir faire face à l’éducation de ses enfants. Son crédit lui servira à l’achat des légumes, du  poissons et divers.
texts.en:
Born in 1957, Véronique A. is divorced, with 5 children in her care. She sells vegetables, smoked fish, and other items. Despite her good intentions, she isn’t able to satisfy her clientele due to lack of financial means. She is seeking this loan to strengthen her business, increase sales, and save money to be able to pay for her children’s education. Her loan will help her to buy vegetables, fish, and other items.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables, fish, and misc. items

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Con 52 años y 25 de ellos vendiendo salchipapas, la señora Reynalda se sacrifica por sus hijos y nietos, todo es por y para ellos, cuenta con mucha experiencia y una fiel clientela, lo que le ha permitido ir creciendo de a pocos, lento pero seguro, logrando así casi terminar de cambiar el material noble por el adecuado para su casa, que la comparte con hijos y nietos.

Requiere de 500 soles de préstamo para poder lograr tan ansiada meta, trazada desde hacía 25 años, cuando empezó en un puesto ambulante situado fuera de su casa, que luce hoy en día distinta.
texts.en:
At 52, with 25 years spent selling salchipapas (sausage and fries), Señora Reynalda sacrifices herself for her children and grandchildren, everything is for them. She has plenty of experience and a faithful clientele, which has permitted her to keep growing little by little, slowly but surely. She has almost succeeded at finishing the house she shares with her children and grandchildren. She needs a loan of $175 in order to complete this long-desired task, envisioned 25 years ago, when she started in a mobile kiosk outside of her house, and now seeing the light of day.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of her salchipapa business with a roof and floor

loans.name: Beauté

texts.fr: Agée de 18 ans, Mlle M. Beauté a abandonné ses études fautes de moyens et s’est lancée dans l’apprentissage de la couture. Aujourd’hui elle est obligée d’aller chez ses amies afin de satisfaire sa clientèle car elle n’a pas les moyens pour s’acheter une machine à coudre. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter sa propre machine à coudre afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle à l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Ms. Beauté M., age 18, abandoned her studies due to a lack of means and got started in a dressmaking apprenticeship. Today, she is obliged to do her work in the homes of her friends in order to satisfy her customers because she does not have the money to buy a sewing machine. She is requesting financing to buy her own sewing machine to satisfy her customers better as the year-end holidays are approaching.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto tiene 23 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija, y por el momento está viviendo en la casa de sus suegros. Desde muy niño ha trabajado en la agricultura, su padre falleció cuando él tenia 13 años, desde entonces, apoya a su madre en la chacra, hace poco inició su propia familia, entonces, trabaja unos días para su madre y los otros días en su casa. Lo más gratificante para él son los dias de feria, porque puede vender la papa que produce y el dinero vuelve a sus manos, para con ello vuelva a sembrar, el resto de días se dedica al cultivo, cosecha y selección de la papa. Su deseo es alquilar un puesto en el mercado mayorista, dice que le sería más rentable, porque ganaría directamente, sin revendedores, porque cuando vende al por mayor los mayoristas le pagan lo que quieren y no el precio de acuerdo al mercado. Este ya es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado pagará el adelanto por el alquiler de un puesto, y con la otra parte comprará abono que necesita para sus chacras de papa.
texts.en:
Alberto, 23, is partnered and has a daughter. For now, he's living with his in-laws. He's worked in farming since he was a boy. His father died when he was 13 and he's supported his mother since by working in the fields. Since starting his own family, he works for his mother part of the time and for his own family part of the time. The happiest days for him are market days because he can sell the potatoes that he grows and collect the money that he's earned. He then returns to plant again. The rest of his time is spent growing, harvesting and sorting potatoes. He would like to rent a space in the main market. He says that it would be very profitable because he would sell directly, without resellers. Wholesalers pay what they want rather than the prices agreed on in the market. This is Alberto's ninth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and he's repaid all of the loans on time. With this loan, he will pay in advance for a market space and buy fertilizer that he needs for his potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Market stall rental and fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Making fufu (porridge) from cassava is one trade that is lucrative for Justina A.. She has been working in this business for some time now. She is married with 5 children and she is forty years old. Her children are in secondary and primary school. They also help her when they are free. 

She purchases her cassava from the village market and takes them to the city to mill them and get the fufu out of them. Justina needs a loan of N30000 to purchase more cassava to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava  to sell

loans.name: Suraiya M. Latif Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is a 48-year-old married lady and has resided in a city named Borewala, Paksitan, for the past 13 years. She couldn’t get an education due to her parents' little financial resources. She is married to a man whose name is M. L. and he is a gardener. She is a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son is a mason. Another reads in 2nd standard. Her first two daughters are involved in a carpet weaving business. Her youngest daughter reads in 3rd standard.

Suraiya baji handles a milk selling business independently. She does this work to fulfill the needs of her family, because it’s a difficult task for a single person to serve the family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk selling business.

She is the group leader of some more women of her locality. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Rafiqan naz baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Abida parveen baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk selling business

loans.name: Nyamjamyan

texts.en: Nyamjamyan J. is a 40-year-old woman who has been running a clothing sales business since 2000 at "Narantuul," the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia. Ninety percent of the clothes she sells are sewn by her husband. Her husband used to work at a clothing factory as a cutter and tailor. In 2000, her husband was laid off because of adverse conditions with the business. Nyamjanyan had had her own clothing business since 1996 -- buying clothes at the Chinese border city of Ereen and reselling them at a local market -- but in 2000, they began to run a family clothing business together. Nyamjanyan's husband sews men's suits and topcoats, and she irons and sells them. He sews and she irons 2-3 items per day. The average cost of each suit and coat is MNT 20,000-30,000 (USD $13-20), and they resell them for an average price of MNT 35,000-60,000 ($25-40 USD). When Nyamjamyan took her first loan, her family lived in a "ger" (a traditional nomadic Mongolian home) on a plot of land the family owns. She has one daughter, who goes to elementary school. From their business profits, they built a house to live in. The loan she is taking now is to buy more cloth to make suits and coats.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to make suits and coats

loans.name: Mirna Yolanda

texts.es: la sra Mirna J. se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, actividad que ella realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante en diferentes comunidades cercanas a la de donde ella vive. ella tiene cuatro años y medio de dedicarse a esta actividad, desde que ella inicio su negocio propio ha mejorado su calidad de vida, ella vive en union libre y tiene 3 hijos hermosos los cuales son su adoracion y ella trabaja solo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, su compañero de hogar es contratista de madera  y aserrador de la misma ya que en donde ellos viven es una zona rica en madera de pino. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder tener mejores ventas y mas  ganancias ya que la situacion es nuestro pais es muy critica y necesita mas dinero para poder alimentar a sus hijos y darles todo para que tengan una buena vida.
texts.en:
Mirna J. has a business selling new clothes, which she does both from her home and as an ambulatory saleswoman in different communities near her own. She has done this work for four and a half years, and since she started her own business, she has improved her quality of life. She lives with her partner and has three beautiful children who are the apples of her eye, and she works only in order to ensure her children can move forward. Her live-in partner is a wood-contractor and sawyer (timber merchant), as they live in an area rich in pine wood. She needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise and thus increase her sales and profits, as the economic situation in our country at the moment is critical and she needs more money in order to be able to feed her children and give them everything the need for a good life.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dresses, bras, underwear, blouses, sandals etc.

loans.name: Ley's Group
loans.use: To buy more fishing nets for her family's business.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: Percy tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres. Sus padres eran agricultores y sembraban sin la necesidad de fertilizantes químicos, ya de adulto, trabaja con la misma dinámica para sus cultivos de alverjas, pero esta vez sus plantas no se están desarrollando como esperaba, lo cual no entiende el por qué, ya que sembró en chacras cosechadas de papa que ya estaba abonadas. Entonces, se verá obligado a comprar fertilizantes químicos para hacer que se desarrollen las alverjas y den buen fruto. A Percy le gusta mucho las labores agrícolas, en cada temporada siembra alverjas porque son muy rentables y una vez cosechadas las lleva a los mercados de Tarma para venderlas. En sus planes aun no está de hacer familia todavía, quiere sembrar en hectáreas numerosas para ganar más dinero. Percy es un joven muy inquieto y dentro de su grupo es muy bromista, este es el 8vo préstamo que viene trabajando con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser responsable en efectuar sus pagos en las cuotas señaladas. El dinero que solicita es para comprar de fertilizantes como la urea y nitrato para apurar el desarrolló de acorde al tiempo climatológico sus alverjas.
texts.en:
Percy is 26 years old, single, and lives at home with his parents. His parents were farmers and did their planting without the need for chemical fertilizers. Now that he's an adult, he uses the same method to cultivate his peas. But this time his plants are not developing the way he expected them to and he doesn't understand why since he planted on plots of land planted with potatoes that were already fertilized. So now he will have to buy chemical fertilizers to make the peas grow and produce good returns. Percy loves his agricultural work. He plants peas each season because they are very profitable. He brings them to the market to sell once they are harvested. He doesn't plan to have a family yet. He wants to plant many hectares to earn more money. Percy is a very lively young man and among his friends is considered the jokester. This is his 8th loan with MFP and all this time he has proved to be responsible about making his payments when they are due. The money he is asking for is to buy fertilizers, like urea and nitrate, to make his peas grow more quickly according to the climate.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is sixty years old. She has been a widow for some years now. She has nine children, five sons and four daughters. According to her, all are out of school. Some are learning trades while others are married and working. Yaa lives with some of her grandchildren in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Yaa works very hard to provide for the grandchildren. She is a trader. She trades in all kinds of food items such as cooking oil, vegetables, fish, etc. Yaa sells on a table top in front of her house. She procures the goods from Accra. Yaa has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure the goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk for resale

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es: El señor José Félix F. A., tiene la edad de 54 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio en la comunidad de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa la cual le apoya  con las actividades del hogar, esposa tiene 4hijos, ya todos independientes, los planes hacia  su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Don José Félix desde hace 30 años se dedica a  la agricultura, el mayor problema que se le ha presentado durante este tiempo es la falta de financiamiento, el inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos, los planes hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo. Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena producción
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Felix F. A. is 54 years old and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood in the community of Ticuantepe with his wife, who is a homemaker. They have 4 children who are all independent. He plans to improve his family living conditions. Mr. Jose Felix has dedicated himself to the agriculture for the last 30 years. The greatest challenge he has faced during this time is the lack of financial help. He started in this activity whit his own efforts; he plans to diversify his crop. With the funding obtained he will buy supplies and fertilizers for the crops so he can have a good production.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 39 years old. He is single but has two children that are living with their mother. Currently all his children attend school. He works very hard to provide for his family, and he lives in Sefwi in the Western Region of Ghana. He trades in electronic parts like rechargeable lamps and torch lights. He sells them through house-to-house hawking during his community market days. And he has also been in business for a year now. He wants to use the loan to buy different kinds of rechargeable lamps. His stock of goods comes from Kumasi, which is a nearby city center. With the loan, he wants to save part for the children's education and rent a store to house his goods.

loans.use: To buy electronic gadgets like rechargeable lamps and torch lights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize and cocoyams

loans.name: Tumwebaze B Mbasagi Jane Group

texts.en:
M. Jane operates a grocery store selling sweet bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, etc. She is 45 years of age, blessed with eight children, of whom four are going to school. She is also taking care of one sibling. She has been in business for over two years. She is using this loan to purchase grocery items to add stock to her business. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to educate her children.
M. Jane is the group leader of Tumwebaze B.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for stock

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is 45 years old and married with a child. She lives in Warri with her family. She sells second-hand shoes and belts. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more second-hand shoes and belts to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand shoes and belts to sell

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa manages a general store business while her husband works as a driver for a bank in Bayombong. With only a small amount of capital, Diosa was able to purchase different grocery items that she sells in her store. However, with a desire to make her business grow, she is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders that will serve as additional capital for her store. She knows that her income will increase through her requested loan.

Diosa and her husband's greatest dream is to send their children to school. They want their children to have a stable job some day so they are working hard to provide for their education.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine S. is a married woman with two young children, ages 5 and 11, who lives in the village of Brgy. Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. At 29 years old, she is a young entrepreneur who is proving that it is possible to break the cycle of poverty if you just give it your best shot. She started her business from nothing and now she knows that she has found the right path to achieving her hopes and dreams - to have her own fishing boat and save enough for her children's future.

Before she started her business, Geraldine's husband worked as a helper at a construction site, earning the minimum daily wage, which was not nearly enough to meet the needs of their family. At the time, Geraldine was herself unemployed, and was totally dependent on her husband's take home pay, which he turned over to her so that she could budget for their expenses. That was fine while it was just them, but when she became pregnant with her first child, she realized that if she did not take the initiative, her children might grow up to be construction workers just like their father, or unemployed like her, and continue to be poor.

This realization motivated her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 to access the much needed capital to start her own business. She used her first loan to buy basic fishing equipment and went to work. At times, when her husband had no construction work, they both went fishing. The income was good and she was able to save enough to purchase a motorized boat and employ a helper. Aside from her fishing business, she was also able to start raising pigs. She earns an average monthly net income of 3,000 pesos from her ventures. Her previous loan of 7,000 pesos was used as additional capital for her business, and was paid in full on time. She is now borrowing 9,000 pesos on her eighth loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon to add capital to her pig-raising business. She intends to save her earnings for the future security of her children.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additonal capital for her piggery business

loans.name: Oviawe

texts.en: E. is married with 2 children and she is 37years old.  She sells baby things for the past 9years. She has been with LAPO Microfinance for the past 6years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more babythings. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more babythings to sell.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Erma Anino is from the village of Tuyabang Alto. She is 48 years old. Erma is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Erma owns & operates a "sari-sari" store n the retail sector. Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2006, Erma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma has successfully repaid previous loans  from PMPC. Erma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Erma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo C. would like a loan amounting to Php5,000 for additional capital for his food vending business. He works in the food retailing business where he sells fish and squid balls.

Most of the time his customers are elementary and high school students. That’s why he is able to sell all of his products. He hopes to further expand his business by increasing the types of items he sells. That's why he decided to borrow Php5,000 from KIVA lenders. According to him, he has been engaged in this business for almost a year. He generates Php250 daily, which contributes to their daily needs. His bicycle serves as his partner in vending his products. He wants to improve his business with the help of the loan.

Domingo is married to Ester, a full time housewife. They are blessed with three children; Desiree, Danica, and Daniel Althea. The family is harmoniously residing at the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela, which is one kilometer away from the national highway.

loans.use: Additional items for his food vending business

loans.name: Mr. Mer Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 13 people who all live in Kruos village in Takeo province. Mr. Mer N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Kong Thol, is a weaver. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she needs some money to buy more raw materials for weaving. In order to solve this problem, Mr. Mer N. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. He is 61 years old and the father of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Karla Rosa

texts.es:
Karla Rosa es una socia joven con ganas de superación, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de jugos y sándwichs actividad que realiza con su madre. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas”.
Karla necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de implementos de la juguerìa. 
El sueño de Karla es tener una fuente de soda y apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Karla Rosa, 19, is a young woman with a strong desire to do well. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She is single and sells juices and sandwiches with her mother. She is a member of the "Las Fresitas" communal bank. She needs a 300 new sol loan to buy supplies for the juice bar. Karla's dream is to have a soda fountain and help her parents with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her juice bar.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en: Mira, 44 years old, is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has three children and her oldest child is 17 years old. Mira does farming for a living. Being unable to provide financially for her farm, she went to individuals, who lent money with high interest. Her income was barely enough and she was unable to save for her childrens education. When she learned about CEVI, she settled her responsibilities and joined the MFI. She said that with its low interest rate, she is able to gain an income. She is now requesting for a loan of Php15, 000. She will use this loan to finance her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en:
Farouk is a 36-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Farouk has been working in the sanitary business since 2008. Farouk requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Farouk has requested a loan.

Farouk is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the required tools. He decided on doing his business because he learned it since he was young. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio E. tiene un pequeño establecimiento de billar en su casa de habitación además de vender golosinas, hielo, gaseosas, popsicles, pan dulce y simple, etc. 
El va a utilizar este crédito en la compra de varias cajillas de gaseosas, golosinas, pan para surtir más su negocio.
Antes de tener su propio establecimiento él trabajaba como asalariado, fue ahí donde ahorro dinero y compro las 2 mesas de billar que hoy en día son las que le traen el sustento diario a su casa, además de la venta de gaseosas, pan, hielo, popsicles, etc. Que todos los días vende.
El espera que surtiendo el negocio de las gaseosas,  pan y golosinas le ayuden mucho porque tendrá más ingresos  en su negocio.
Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con CEPRODEL, y el dijo que sus créditos le han ayudado mucho a crecer en su negocio y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sergio runs a small billiard hall in his home. He also sells sweets, ice, soft drinks, popsicles, breads, etc. He will use the money from this loan to buy cases of soft drinks, treats, and breads so that he can have a variety to offer. Before he started his own business, he worked as a salaried employee, which is how he was able to save the money to buy two billiard tables, which now bring a daily income into his home, aside from his sale of the snacks. He hopes that the variety of soft drinks and snacks will help him increase his revenue. This will be his second loan thought CEPRODEL and he tells us that the loans have helped him grow his business and have helped his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and snacks for resale

loans.name: Lodovina

texts.es:
Lodovina es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Lodovina es separada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Lodovina tiene un puesto en el mercado de Carmen alto en donde vende ropa y zapatos. Además viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana.
Lodovina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería.
Los sueños de Lodovina son mejorar su negocio, surtir con mas productos y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lodovina is a member of the Communal Bank “Azucenas” (Lilies). She is 43 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four children. Lodovina has a vending post at the Carmen Alto Market where she sells clothing and shoes. She also travels to the fairs twice a week.

Lodovina is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN in order to buy lingerie. She dreams of improving her business, increasing her inventory with more products, and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Noberto

texts.es:
Norberto C.,  Labora como vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, ella tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo,  y dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, es su primer  crédito con CEPRODEL y este va hacer invertido en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales eléctricos como: alambres y caja para el sistema eléctrico de su   casa.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Norberto dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Norberto C. works as a security guard at the Mercado Mayoreo in Managua. He is married and has four children under his responsibility (two of them are school-aged minors). This is his first loan from CEPRODEL and it will be invested in home improvements. The loan will be used to buy electrical materials such as wire and an electrical box for his house. All this work is with the objective of providing more security and a better quality of life for his children. Norberto said that the loan will be used for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie E. is from the village of  Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting bananas for sale. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
Phillis is 27 years old, is married, and has a 3-year-old daughter. She has been selling vegetables for three years and employs one person. She also sells second-hand clothes in an open air market.

Phillis belongs to Faulu Kenya under a group called Imani Mukuru. Being a member of this group, she has been able to save her money and access a loan of Kes 20,000 which she used to boost her business and successfully repaid.

Phillis has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to add to her stock of vegetables. She hopes to grow her business and buy a lorry (truck) for supplying vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: To add to her stock of vegetables

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry S. is from the village of Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 38 years old, married, and has school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily food in the local community. Cherry has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Cherry joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital to purchase products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia Z. is from the village of North Park Area, Wao Lanao del Sur. She is 59 years old. Lydia is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Lydia operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling soft drinks and energy drinks in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Lydia joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: North Park Area, Wao, Lanao de Sur

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Five people in Doung Khpos village in Takeo make up this group loan. Mrs. Srey P. is the group leader, selected by the other members. Each member will use a small piece of the loan for a different purpose. She is 46 years old. She is a weaver at her home where she can earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Srey P. is applying for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Sarou Sok, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Through this activity, they support five children. One child is a weaver, one is a car repairer, and the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en:
Today the variety of jobs and occupations has made the job market extremely wide and every individual can get occupied with any work or activity according to his own scope of interest, skills, whims and desires. The most important thing is not to slack off and be lazy. For hardworking, ambitious people there are lots of opportunities waiting for them. One has to just see it and grab it outright. This is the distinguishing trait of a successful individual: to see the chance and do his best to use it. And chances and opportunities are always there. Nurgul A. is the leader of this group. She is 42 and has three children. Her husband is a builder. To make a living, Nurgul also works.  She is a saleswoman. She trades in meat. She started working after her husband had gone to Russia to work. She needed money and instead of asking her relatives for help, decided to try being a seller and it did work out. Now, her work allows her to not only meet her family’s daily needs but also pay for her daughter’s education. Nurgul has applied for this loan to buy five sheep for feeding and resale. 

Nurgul’s partners: 

Mirlan T., 23, is single. He has decided to start his own business breeding cattle. He hopes to obtain this loan to buy cattle. Mirlan plans to do this business together with his wife.

Nargiza A., 24, is single. She trades in vegetables and fruits. Nargiza has decided to apply for this loan as she has long been planning to buy a new fridge and also to invest part of this loan in her business.

Nurlanbek T., 33, is a father of two children. His wife works as a cook. As to Nurlanbek, he is engaged in raising cattle. Nurlanbek needs this loan to pay for sowing and tractor services. 

Aida A., 31, has two children and works as a saleswoman. Her husband is a builder. Aida hopes to obtain this loan to buy four sheep. She plans to feed and resell them afterwards. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año, Lida tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril, en donde vende frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, negocio que inicio hace 2 meses con dinero del préstamo que adquirió.
Lida es socia del  Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua y llego a ser socia por invitación de su mama. Lida necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas.
Lida sueña con construir su casa de material noble pues la que tiene es de material rustico.
texts.en:
Lida is lives with her partner and has a 1-year-old son. Lida has a stall in the “12th of April” market where she sells a variety of fruit everyday from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. She started the business two months ago with the money from the loan she obtained. Lida is a member of the Ccatarisum Communal Bank, which means “Lift ourselves up” in Quecha. She became a member by her mother’s invitation. Lida needs a loan of 600 soles, money that will be invested in purchasing fruit. Lida dreams of constructing a house of finer material, since the one she has now is rustic.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Unidas Por Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
