LA SRA. SARA TIENE 34 AÑOS D. EDAD, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS MENORES. HACE CUATRO MESES ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "UNIDAS POR UN FUTURO", ÉSTE GRUPO TIENE 11 INTEGRANTES, LA MAYORÍA D. ELLOS VIVE EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS UBICADO AL NORTE D. LIMA. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.

LA SRA. SARA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. ANTICUCHOS, TODAS LAS NOCHES UBICA SUS MESITAS Y PARRILA EN LA PUERTA D. SU DOMICILI0. INICIÓ VENDIENDO TAMALES, ARROZ CON LECHE Y MAZAMORRA, LA GANANCIA QUE TENÍA LO JUNTÓ PARA PODER ADQUIRIR UNA PEQUEÑA PARRILLA CON LA CUAL INICIA SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. ANTICUCHOS. 
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO APOYAR A SUS HIJOS EN GASTOS ESCOLARES COMO LOS ÚTILES Y PAGO DEL COLEGIO.

ELLA TRABAJA CON LA META D. AHORRAR PARA LOS GASTOS UNIVERSITARIOS D. SUS HIJOS EN UN FUTURO CUANDO ELLOS TERMINEN EL COLEGIO.

EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS, INGREDIENTES, UTENSILIOS Y DESCARTABLES PARA IMPLEMENTAR SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. ANTOCUCHOS.
texts.en:
Sara, 34, is married and has three minor children. She has been a member of the "UNIDAS POR UN FUTURO" (United for a Future) group for the past 4 months. The group has 11 members most of whom live in the Comas district north of Lima. Her fellow group members elected her president of the group’s governing board. Sara sells anticuchos (skewered, grilled beef heart) nightly. She sets up her grill and tables in her front yard. She started out selling tamales, rice pudding and bread pudding. With profits from this she bought a small grill with which she started her anticucho sales. Her work has maD. it possible for her to pay for her children’s school expenses like tuition and school supplies. She works with the goal in mind to save up for her children’s future university costs once they finish high school. She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients, supplies and disposable utensils to set up her anticucho sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inredients and supplies for her Anticucho sales business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose G. is currently in the business of selling sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and beans. She is requesting a loan to stock maize flour and pulses (ground nuts, peas and cowpeas) to sell.  

Rose is 47 years old and married to a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock maize flour and pulses to sell

loans.name: Mery Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  es la Sra. Mery; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es  madre soltera;   La socia tiene 1 hijo,  y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella vende carne en el mercado de rosas pata. La socia es padre y madre para su hijo, ella trabaja mucho para poder cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne del camal al por mayor para la venta. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mery, 47, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE CHAPI” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is a single mother of a son. She combines her household chores with retail. She sells meat at the Rosas Pata Market. She is both father and mother to her son and works hard to meet all the household’s needs. She is asking for a loan to buy meat from the slaughterhouse at wholesale for subsequent resale. She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat from the slaughterhouse at wholesale for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Flor Esmeralda

texts.es: Flor Esmeralda R. D. H. D. 36 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar como comerciante, y junto a sus tres hijos D.: 15, 13 y 11 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Flor tiene como profesión el ser costurera, es por ello que cuenta con un taller D. costura en su casa D. habitación, la cual se encuentra en Soyapango, lugar en el cual atienD. a diferentes clientes los cuales hacen sus pedidos con algunos días D. anticipación y D. esta manera Flor pueda hacer diferentes prendas D. vestir. Así mismo ella elabora uniformes para empresas y escuelas, lo que le permite contar con muy buenas ganancias. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin D. comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima como: tela, botones, hilos D. diferentes colores y algunos repuestos para sus maquinas, D. esta manera ella espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así mismo obtener alguno nuevos.
texts.en:
Flor Esmeralda R. D. H., 36, lives with her husand, who is a merchant, and their three children who are 15, 13 and 11 years of age and who are students. Flor is a seamstress and has a workshop in her home in Soyapango. She has several customers who place orders with her a few days ahead of time so that Flor can make the various articles of clothing. She also manufactures uniforms for schools and business firms which provides good profits. She is asking for funds to buy larger amounts of raw materials like: fabric, buttons and threads in various colors as well as some replacement parts for her sewing machines so that she can proviD. better customer service as well as acquire new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons and thread.

loans.name: Besta

texts.en: Besta G. is currently in the business of selling ladies' dresses, radios and bags and is requesting a loan to stock more bags to sell. Besta is 25 years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house and to buy goats.

loans.use: To stock more bags to sell.

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es: El grupo   la Vecindad del Cinco está conformado por 7 miembros los cuales todos se dedican al comercio minoritario como venta de ropa bodegas etc., tiene formado hace mas de 7 años los cuales han hecho una labor extraordinaria con las ganancias de las prestaciones. Un caso en particular es el de la señora Beatriz B., con 39 años de edad sale adelante cada día con su negocio de venta ambulatoria de ropa, el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones como los estudios de sus 4 hijos en el colegio, alimentos, vestimenta y un techo donde vivir. Con el presente préstamo piensa invertirlo en comprar  prendas de vestir para el verano y ahorrar para la compra futura de una maquina cortadora de tela, el cual le seria de mucha ayuda en su negocio. Cada integrante del  grupo  la vecindad del cinco tiene un desempeño laboral distinto. Pero todos coinciden en la dedicación  y el esfuerzo que dan todos los días para progresar  y salir a delante.
texts.en:
The “Vecindad del Cinco” (Neighborhood of the Five) has seven members who are all retailers.  They sell clothes and groceries, for example.  It has been in operation for over 7 years and they have done an extraordinary job with profits from the loans.

One case in particular is Mrs. Beatriz Bazán, 39.  She goes out every day with her ambulatory clothing sales business.  This business has brought her many benefits, like being able to educate her four children, providing food, clothing and a roof over their heads.

She plans to use the present loan to buy summer clothes and to save up to buy a fabric cutting machine in the future that will be very helpful for her business.

Every member of the group has a different job but they all agree on dedication and daily effort to make progress and continue to move forward.

loans.use: To buy summer clothes.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim, who lives in Depalpur, a small city in Pakistan, is a widow who lost her husband few years ago as a result of sudden death. Devastated by this tragedy, she recovered herself for the sake of her three sons and three daughters. Unfortunately, none of them could get an education because Shamim’s husband was the only breadwinner of the family and after his death, managing the school fees became impossible for Shamim.

Because all family responsibilities then came to rest on Shamim's shoulders, she started a clothes-sewing business, receiving orders from her neighbors to fulfill the basic needs of her family. Now, as her eldest son has grown, she has taught her sewing skills to him and he is now supporting the family financially from his earnings. She is now requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son to purchase a sewing machine, a purchase that will enable him to complete his work on time and receive more orders that will earn him more income.

A regular client of Asasah, this is Shamim's second loan application. In the previous loan year, she demonstrated good credit behavior and attended all meetings.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Manson

texts.en:
Manson is a single man who lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is paying school fees for his younger siblings.

He operates an electronic shop, selling spare parts for repairing televisions, radios and mobile phones.  His potential customers are passersby and neighbours.  Manson faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand his electronics shop and sell wholesale. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase spare parts and equipment for repairing televisions, radios and mobile phones.

loans.use: To purchase spares parts and equipment for repairing televisions, radios and mobile phones.

loans.name: 0305014-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en:
Lien N. T. (12) is a 50- year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Lien is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 0305014-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh (0305014-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh).


Lien is married and has four adult children.  To make a living, Lien operates a family member's business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Lien has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Thinh (105) is a 42-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Chat (7) is a 38-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Xang (41) is a 56-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her general store business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lien N. T. (12) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Lien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0305014-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh (0305014-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở đại dương trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lien kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Lien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua T.ết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Thinh (105) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Chat (7) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. T. Xang (41) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy used handbags to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose T. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods like tomatoes, beans, and maize flour, and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour to sell. Rose is 23 years old and is married to a peasant. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To stock more bags of maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer T. (pictured here in FATEN's office) is 22 years old and a student from Tulkarem. She wants to finish school and start working so she can help her father take care of the family and help her younger brother finish school.

Tahreer came to FATEN and requested a $2,000 loan to pay school tuition fees and for school supplies. Tahreer's father is a national authority employee and will help her repay the loan.

loans.use: To pay school tuition fees

loans.name: James

texts.en: James N. K. is married and has a two-year-old child. His business is located in Embakasi, in Nairobi, and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He sells shoes at a busy market near the main road. He has been in this business for the last six years and has managed to employ one person. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is the high number of  people doing the same kind of business in the area; customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more shoes so he can grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He describes himself as an ambitious man.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celinda; ella tiene 40 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de transporte ella tiene un  bus interprovincial el cual la socia lo administra, el bus sale todos los días en la ruta del Valle Sagrado tiene su chofer el cual maneja el bus y muy de vez en cuando su esposo también maneja, la socia a la vez es docente del nivel primario en el colegio nacional de Urubamba siendo estas dos las únicas actividades que realiza por el momento  para así poder sacar a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento del carro y comprar algunos accesorios que le hacen falta.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Celinda is a member of the “SEÑOR PASION” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Celinda is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her transport business.  Celinda owns a bus which travels between provinces.  She is in charge of managing the bus which runs every day on the Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley) route.  She has a driver who drives the bus and her husband drives it too though not very often.  Celinda is also an elementary school teacher at 'Colegio Nacional de Urubamba'.  These are the only work activities she carries out right now in order to get her family ahead in life.

Celinda is requesting her loan so that she can have maintenance work done on her vehicle and so that she can buy some accessories that she lacks.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance work on her vehicle and to buy some accessories that she lacks

loans.name: Jara

texts.en:
Jara A. is a sixty-seven year old widowed lady. She is a mother of four grown chidren. She owns rental houses in Kibera estate. She is served by Kitengela branch. She has been in this business for the last fifty years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints, especially when there is a need to renovate the houses.

She works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to renovate her rental houses. She hopes to buy another plot and build more rental houses in future. She sees herself building flats to let some day. She describes herself as hardworking, honest and keeps on schedule.

loans.use: Renovation of rental houses.

loans.name: Solidario Unidos Por Cristo Group

texts.es:
Solidario Unidos Por Cristo: esta Formado por doña Telma Esperanza,de 59 años ella es dueña de una farmacia
ubicada en su comunidad, tiene 2 hijos pero ya no viven con ella porque ya estan casados, ella trabaja desde hace 8 años en su farmacia,ella solicita este credito para la compra de medicina matural.
doña Maria Lucia, de 21 años de edad tiene 1 hijo y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica ella sale a vender sus prendas de casa en casa por la aldea donde ella vive,desde hace 2 años.solicita el credito para compra de materia prima para elavorar tejidos tipicos.
doña Irma Esperanza, de 30 años ella es viuda se dedica a la tortilleria y tambien hace fajas y costuras de cortes tipicos desde hace 5 años tiene 3 hijos ella nos cuenta que desde que enviudo le a costado,mucho poder sacar adelante a sus hijos pero esta contenta porque tiene trabajo pero no suficiente ganancia para poder invertir ella solicita este credito para comprar leña por mayor y tambien maiz por mayor para seguir con su tortilleria,
texts.en:
The group Solidario Unidos Por Cristo is comprised of:
59 year old Telma who runs a pharmacy located in her community. She has 2 children, but they don't live with her any more because they are married. She has been working in her pharmacy for 8 years. She is requesting a loan to buy natural medicines. 
21 year old Maria Lucia has one son and she works selling the traditional clothes of the region. She sells her goods door to door in the village where she lives, and has been doing this for 2 years. She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make traditional fabrics.
30 year old Esperanza is a widow who runs a tortilla business and also makes sashes and traditional clothes, and has been doing this for 5 years. She has 3 children. She tells us that, since she was widowed, it has been hard for her bringing up her children. She is happy because she has her work, but doesn't have enough profits to invest. She is requesting a loan to buy wood in bulk and also corn for her tortilla business.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine, raw materials to make fabrics, and wood and corn in bulk

loans.name: Aguilas De Corazon Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”ÁGUILAS DE CORAZÓN”, está iniciando su octavo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de nueve  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Mery. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos la carpintería, venta de lana, venta de celulares, venta de chamarras, venta de comida, comercio, venta de salchipapas, comercio de zapatos, venta de ropa.

La presidenta, señora Mery es una mujer joven, tiene 26 años y esta esperando un bebe. Este es su cuarto año que trabaja con asociaciones comunales,  desarrollando un negocio sola. 

En la actualidad comercializa celulares, los que compra de ocasión, nos cuenta que con el crédito que sacará pretende comprar más mercadería que venderá en la feria de la 16 de julio de forma ambulante, pues ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo.

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora Mery responde  el crédito.
texts.en:
The ”Águilas de Corazón" [Eagles With Heart] Community Lending Association is starting its eight loan cycle in the Los Andes Regional Office.  There are nine members of the association, and Mery is the president of the board of directors.

The women are in different businesses, including woodworking, and sales of wood, cell phones, jackets, meals, salchipapas [sausage and potatoes], shoes, and clothing.

Mery, the president, is a young woman of 26, who is expecting a baby.  This is her fourth year working with community lending associations and she's building her business on her own.  

Currently Mery is a cell phone vendor; she buys the phones second hand.  She tells us she plans to use her loan to buy more merchandise to sell at the 16 de Julio Market from her mobile cart, since she doesn't have a permanent stand.

When we asked Mery what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
Sandra, tiene 29 años de edad, reside en Santiago de María departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de pan y atoles, vive con su hijo de 10 años, también su madre de 62 años de edad, tiene casa propia. El negocio consiste en la compra y venta de pan dulce y francés, también prepara atoles y tablilla, esto lo aprendió de su madre, lo realiza hace 7 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, comprando pan para la venta, también maíz, azúcar y cacao, con estos materiales que compre está garantizando continuidad al negocio, y recibir ingresos para su hogar.
Las aspiraciones de Sandra prosperar en el negocio, aumentar la clientela y atenderles bien, también ayudar a su madre en lo necesario al igual que a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra is 29 years old and lives in Santiago de María, in Usulután department.  She sells bread and 'atoles' (a traditional, cornstarch-based hot drink).  She lives with her 10 year-old son and her 62 year-old mother in her own home.  Her business is buying and selling sweet bread and French bread.  She also makes atoles and bars of chocolate.  She learned this business from her mother and has been in it for seven years.

Sandra is currently requesting a loan to invest in her business, buying bread to sell.  She will also buy corn, sugar and cacao.  With these materials, she will be guaranteeing the continuity of her business and will make income for her household.

Sandra's aspirations are to prosper in her business, to increase her customer base and to serve her customers well.  She would also like to help her mother and her son with whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy bread, corn, sugar and cacao

loans.name: Miriam Aydee

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes actividades como comerciantes y empelados de fabricas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mirian, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10,  4 y de 8 meses de edad, el mayor esta en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
 
Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y ayudar a su esposo con la carga familiar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Esika y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa compra en Guayaquil cuando necesita. Nos cuenta que lleva 4 años que se dedica a esta labor. 

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Está  en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) community bank meets in Bajo de Montecristi, in Manabí province.  This is a small place which is surrounded by a lot of vegetation.  The locals work in different business activities such as selling products and working in factories.

Here we meet 38 year-old Mirian who is married and has three children aged 10, 4 and 8 months.  Her eldest is in school.  Her husband is a driver.

Mirian is a housewife who, in order to make her own money and help her husband with the family expenses, sells all kinds of clothes and also Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  Her beauty products are delivered to her home and she buys the clothes in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She tells us that she has been in this line of work for four years.

Mirian will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and all kinds of clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank since it was founded.  She is in charge of overseeing payments and she enjoys being a member of the bank because it is easy to meet the payments.  

Mirian's dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Zoila, la socia tiene 49 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene una hija; la socia trabaja desde hace 3 años en la venta de productos por catalogo, la socia vende productos de belleza, cremas, colonias, bisutería entre otros, ella es docente de profesión y es una mujer muy emprendedora y llena de vida, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de productos ella pagara el total y una vez que las clientes le cancelen ella puede estar satisfecha, la socia también es docente así que puede ir pagando poco a poco sus deudas ya que estas le servirán para tener su capital de trabajo alterno. La socia solicita el crédito para capitalizarse.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called RENACER (To be Reborn) and is located in Huanchac District which belongs to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Zoila, 49.  She’s single and has a daughter.  She’s worked for the last three years selling items via catalogue.  She sells beauty products, creams, colognes and costume jewelry, among others.  She is a Teacher by profession and a very enterprising woman who is full of life.

She needs the loan to buy products.  She will pay off her entire order and once customers pay her she will be satisfied.  She is also a Teacher so will be able to repay her debts gradually which will help her have alternative working capital.  She is asking for the loan to capitalize herself.

She is grateful and expresses that she will be disciplined with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, aged 32, is a widowed mother of two children, aged 20 and 18 years.

She sells jackets, handbags and clothes by hawking (selling on foot), a business she has been doing for seven years. It earns her a monthly income of 38,800 Kenyan shillings.

This is her fifth loan from KADET LTD., and she has a good credit history with KADET. She will use the loan amount to buy more jackets, handbags and clothes for sale. Jane hopes to start importing clothes on her own in the future.

loans.use: To buy jackets, handbags and clothes for sale.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
Este cliente reside en esta ciudad capital   de Managua, la señora María Francisca se ha caracterizado por ser una dama honrada  trabajadora con buenos valores morales como persona, debido a que ha sabido  ganarse el aprecio de sus  compañeros de labores. 
Hace unos días se presento ante las oficinas para solicitar un crédito para ser invertido para  solucionara y unificar deudas con otras instituciones que tiene pendiente así  quedar trabajando con esta Institución
texts.en: This loan client resides in this capital city of Managua.  Ms. Mary Frances has been characterized as an honest working lady with good moral values and she has earned the esteem of her fellow workers.  A few days ago, she came to the office to apply for a loan, to be invested in the consolidation of loans that she has pending with other institutions, so that she can work with just this one institute.

loans.use: Personal expenses [consolidate loans]

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Susan has a food shop that sells viands like fried fish and vegetable dishes. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell. Susan is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make viands to sell

loans.name: Rabson

texts.en: Rabson is a twenty six year-old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him and his desire is to educate his children up to university. He has been selling cassava flour for four years. His hardship is the rising price of agricultural products. His vision is to own a food store. Rabson needs the loan to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour and beans  to sell sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urquillos en la Provincia de Calca y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, la socia es casada; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y a la agricultura; la socia tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz blanco y ella produce choclos, los cuales son vendidos en ferias y en la ciudad de Cusco; la socia también vende verduras en el mercado en Urubamba y ahora que comenzaron la siembras de maíz y verduras ella necesita comprar semillas de maíz blanco y de verduras para sembrar, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para la plantación en la siembra de maíz blanco y de verduras.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Alicia, 39, is a member of the “Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos” communal bank which is located in Urquillos District in Calca Province and Cusco Department.

She is married.  She’s a farmer and vegetable merchant.  She has fields planted with white corn and she produces corn on the cob that are sold at markets and in the city of Cusco.  She also sells vegetables in the Urubamba market and now that planting season for corn and vegetables has begun she needs to buy white corn seeds and vegetable seeds to plant.  She needs the loan to buy seeds to plant her white corn and vegetables crops.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy white corn seeds and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Voun

texts.en:
We know that the farming business is one business where it is very hard to earn enough income to support a family as well as others. But Mrs. Voun and her husband try to work hard every day to feed their children and provide good living standards. Both of them work as farmers. They can earn about $4 per day. They are raising two children. 

To create a small family in prosperity and modern as others, Mrs. Voun and her husband would like to borrow the amount of $750 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en: Sreypov, 40 year old, is housewife. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $5 per day. They have two children who they are working in the factory earning $4 per day  each. Every month, Sreypov has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She is requesting  a loan of $200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motor taxi service. He can can make more income  doing this than working as a construction worker. In the future, Sreypov wants to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to have a motor taxi service

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is married and her husband works in a private office at a monthly wage. Rehana is an educated lady. She is attached to a teaching profession and teaches in a nearby school. She has given birth to two sons. Her eldest one is a motor mechanic and the second one is studying in class 5th. Rehana is also a very good housewife and performs her household tasks very well.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her son’s motor workshop business. With the loan, he will buy spare parts and repair tools to provide better quality services to his customers. He is very good at his work and works with full dedication. He has been operating his business for the past five years. Rehana hopes that an investment will bring more profits to him and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair tools

loans.name: Ana Ydalia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y una hija de 5 años de edad, se dedica a la sastrería y administra una pequeña tienda, este oficio nació hace varios años y ha ganado muchos clientes por su buen servicio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, para la tienda y ciper, hilos para la sastrería, esta compra le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio ya que sus ingresos dependen de las ganancias que recibe del negocio.
El sueño de ella es algún día tener  su propia casa, con el esfuerzo en el negocio espera poder realzarlo.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and a five-year-old daughter. She devotes herself to tailoring and manages a small store. This line of work came into being several years ago and she has gained many customers through her good service. 

She is seeking a loan for the purchase of sugar, rice and oil for the store, and zippers and thread for the tailoring business. This purchase will help her build up the business since her income depends on the earnings she receives from the business. 

Her dream is that some day she would have her own home. With her efforts in business, she hopes be able to make it reality.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, oil, zippers and thread.

loans.name: Anunsacion

texts.en:
Anunsacion is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Anunsacion has a tailoring shop where she makes & sells office & school uniforms. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy materials needed for sewing like cloth.
Anunsacion has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Anunsacion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators. One of them is Mr. Soun, who has been working in this sector in Ornlong Veng District in Siem Reap Province since he was single. He and his wife plant various crops on their own farmland, which they inherited from their grandparents. From this business, they can generate an income of around $7.50 USD per day. This humble couple has one single child who is a student. 

Mr. Soun has planted a potato crop, which he will harvest when the potatoes are mature. But his crop is not growing well because it is ravaged by insects and lawn. Because of that obstacle, Mr. Soun has decided to seek a loan to buy insecticide, which he will use to protect his crop, and hire some local laborers to cut down lawn. In the future, Mr. Soun wishes to expand his business activities by feeding animals for extra profit.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and hire some local laborers to cut down lawn

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. Ester is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Ester requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her tailoring business like threads, cloth, etc..

Ester has been in this business for 23 years now.

In the future, Ester would like to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy thread, cloth, etc for her tailoring business

loans.name: Hilda Natalia

texts.es:
Hilda Natalia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, desde hace 6 meses decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de mazamorra por varios barrios de la ciudad de Medellín.

A sus 29 años de edad es madre soltera de una pequeña niña y vive en compañía de su hermana quien le ayuda con el cuidado de la pequeña mientras ella sale a vender sus productos. Pese a que los lugares en los cuales trabaja son altamente afectados por la violencia, Hilda no ve esto como un impedimento para continuar con su negocio, por el contrario ve que cada día van aumentando poco a poco sus ventas, es por esto que solicita un crédito para adquirir nuevas ollas y utensilios donde preparar y transportar más mazamorra, al mismo tiempo que planea ayudar a su comunidad generando dos empleos más y logrando así crecer su empresa, mejorar las ventas, aumentar los ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y la de los nuevos empleados.
texts.en:
Hilda Natalia is a tenacious and enterprising woman.  Six months ago she decided to start up her own business.  She sells “mazamorra” (corn pudding) in the various neighborhoods in the city of Medellín.

She is the 29 year old single mother of a little girl.  She lives with her sister, who helps take care of the little one when Hilda leaves to sell her products.

Even though the places that she works are greatly affected by violence, Hilda does not see this as an impediment to continue with her business.  To the contrary, she sees her sales slowly increasing every day.

That is why she is requesting a loan to get new pots and utensils to prepare and transport more mazamorra.  At the same time she plans to help her community by generating two more jobs.  That way her business will grow, sales will improve, and income will increase.  That will improve her family’s quality of life and that of her new employees.

loans.use: to buy utensils and raw material to improve her business.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Judith is the facilitator of Upendo group. Judith and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Judith takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½  acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Judith will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighbors and clients. She is a very good and skillful worker, and she receives a good number of orders every month. Shazia is the mother of three sons and a daughter. All of them are studying, except the third one who didn’t show an interest in education and remains illiterate

Her husband operates a shop in the market where he sells cigarettes and betel leaves. He also sells cold drinks to his customers. Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business. With the loan, he will put more brands of cigarettes in his shop as well as betel leaves and cold drinks to increase his sales and profits. He has been operating his business for the past six years, and Shazia is hopeful that an investment will help him to increase his profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, betel leaves, and cold drinks to sell.

loans.name: Umoja Farmers Group

texts.en:
Evans is the facilitator of the Umoja Farmers group. Evans and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evans and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Evans takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access the good technology offered and to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Evans had a very good maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Evans was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Evans will save for the future and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Umoja Farmers group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph Evans is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a resident of Murang'a in Central Kenya. He is 23 years old and single. He has been actively farming for more than three years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces bananas, maize, beans, and milk. In addition to farming, he works as a plumber.

Paul has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes for his farming business. This is his second loan with Juhudi; his previous loan was for 30,000 KES. He adds that his farming activities will be more successful with sufficient water supply.

Paul laments the high costs of inputs like fertilizers and the low prices for farming products.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman who has one child. Elma is 28 years old, residing at Ozamis, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Elma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 7,080 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Elma has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Elma wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surge por el contacto de una de las miembros con la asesora de la fundación, ellas entusiasmadas decidieron formar parte del programa de la fundación paraguaya y actualmente ya se encuentran en el décimo ciclo, donde todas ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y dentro de un marco de respeto.
Florinda es una de estas mujeres luchadoras, ellas nos cuenta que por medio de las prendas que vende, ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y salir adelante, su negocio también la ayuda a cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Uno de sus sueños es tener una gran tienda de ropa donde pueda ofrecerle a sus clientes todo tipo de prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá estar preparada para la demanda de sus clientes en esta época de calor. Ella agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le dan, pues así está cada vez más cerca de su sueño.
texts.en:
This group came about through the contact of one of the members with the counselor of the foundation. They enthusiastically decided to create a group in the program for the Fundación Paragaya (Paraguayan Foundation) and currently they are in the 10th cycle, where all of them work collectively within a structure of respect.

Florinda is one of these women fighters. She tells us that through the clothes that she sells, she has been able to help her family get ahead as her business helps her cover the daily household expenses. One of her dreams is to have a big clothing store where she can offer her customers all types of clothing.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy summer clothing, so she can be ready for the requests her clients make in this hot season. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that they give her, as each time she comes closer to her dream.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing for resale

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en una de las compañías de la ciudad de Itá.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo hace más de 3 años, y gracias a esto puede ayudar con los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa. Ella comenta que su sueño es poder tener una tienda grande donde poder ofrecer mayor comodidad y variedad a sus clientes.
La señora Ana es muy responsable y profesional en su trabajo, busca siempre la excelencia en su actividad y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad recibida para compartir con todos su vida profesional.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo que podrá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Ana is from the city of Itá. She is 25 years old and lives at one of the companies in the city of Itá. 

She has made a living selling clothes of all kinds for more than 3 years, and thanks to this she can help with household costs that come up every day. She says that her dream is to be able to have a big store where she can offer the best in comfort and variety to her customers. 

Ana is very responsible and professional in her work. She always seeks excellence at her job and is grateful to the Paraguay Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity to share her professional life with everyone.

She is asking for the loan for the purchase of summer clothing so that she can satisfy the orders she has received.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to subsequently sell.

loans.name: Dababougou Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Dababougou Benkadi 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec    SANATA ,   1 ere debout  en écharpe jaune sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Dababougou Benkadi 5" are married women averaging 31 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with SANATA, the first one standing and wearing a yellow scarf in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining one hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 150,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 40 years old, married with 6 children. Two of her children are already married and have their homes whereas the rest are still in secondary and primary schools. Mercy has been the Treasurer of Kagaa Witeithie Women Group a position she has held since January 2005. She is trustworthy, a dedicated and hard working member of the group. Mercy has a retail shop at Ngurweini trading center. She sells maize flour, rice, sugar, and other household items. She also has a small farmland where she grows maize, beans and vegetables for home consumption and some for selling. In addition, she has a dairy cow and this gives her milk for sell as we as for home consumption. Most of her income comes from her retail shop and others supplement. Her monthly net income is about $73 and this is very low to support her family in future.

loans.use: Mercy wants to stock maize flour, wheat flour, rice, Soap, salt, Maize and beans.

loans.name: Aumaga

texts.en: Aumaga’s business is a taro plantation. With her previous loan, Aumaga extended her interest in not only developing her taro plantation, but also started growing vegetables. With a helping hand from her relatives, she built a small flea market stall for Aumaga to sell her products. Aumaga is a very loving person who welcomes anyone who wants to use her market stall to sell their taros, etc. Her loving support for other ladies in her village has inspired and encouraged them to start up their own small businesses. Now her business has become successful, and she’s applying for her next loan to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides for her taro plantation.

loans.use: Buy bags, organic fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Nat operates a taxi which runs everyday of the week and earns between 200 and 400 tala per day. (1 tala = $0.35 US dollars). The taxi is the main source of income for the family, and Nat needs finance to purchase spare tires for the taxi.

loans.use: To purchase tires

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa S. is twenty years old and has one child. She is married to a self-employed tailor. She runs her small market stall business in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone). She mainly sells sugar, onions and chicken stock cubes.

Hawa’s business income supplements her husband's income so her aim is to expand her business for more profit. Hawa is determined to help provide for her family. She is requesting this loan for the purpose of diversifying her inventory.

loans.use: To diversify the items she sells in her market stall business

loans.name: Alie

texts.en: Alie B. is forty-nine years old and married with five children.  He runs a business selling plastic sandals and clothes.  Alie says most of his income goes to his children’s education requirements and medical care.  Although the previous loan helped him increase his income, he now needs another loan of  $175 to allow him to further expand the business, especially to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 30-year-old single parent. He lost his wife a year ago and is now carrying the burden of taking care of the family alone. Mohamed says that his life was an easier one when his wife was alive because her business supplemented his income. Now life is hard for him. His small business is the only source of income and he has not been able to do much because he was taking care of their child.

Now his child has grown up a little and Mohamed has asked his mother and other members of his extended family to assist him in taking care of the child so that he can expand his business. Mohamed sells adult clothes in the town of Kabala, in Sierra Leone. He is requesting a loan of $275 for the purpose of expanding his business to generate more income.

loans.use: Expansion of his clothing business to generate additional income

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. owns a general store in the Elmina market. She has been at this market for eight years but has been in the business for over 20 years now. Her store is special because she draws many customers with the palm oil that she sells. Palm oil is red and flavorful oil that is a key ingredient in many traditional Ghanaian dishes.

With her loan, Nana Y. hopes to purchase more palm oil as well as expand her stock in onions, tin tomatoes, and groundnuts. She will use the profits to support her three children who are all in school. Two are in middle school and one is in preschool.

Nana Y. is a member of the lending group, Nyame Beba of Elmina. The group members guarantee loans through a group repayment pledge. Peer support provides the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The members of this group have known each other for many years, and they all work in the market.

loans.use: Nana would use her loan to increase her stock of palm oil and add vegetables (onions and tomatoes) and groundnuts.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is a young man who has learned how to get ahead in spite of everything he has had to overcome. Some time ago, his father got terribly ill, and Fernando had to take charge of his business. This is where Fernando saw that the best way of making money was to be his own boss for himself and his family.

However, he doesn't have enough merchandise to offer his clients right now. This is why Fernando is requesting a loan of $375 that he is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, he will be able to buy merchandise to be able to have something to offer his clients. With your help, Fernando will be able to get ahead and to support his family so they don't lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Fernando es un joven que a sabido salir adelante, a pesar de todo lo que a tenido que superar puesto que hace tiempo que su padre se enfermó terriblemente teniendose que ponerse a cargo del negocio Fernando, y ahí fue donde vio que la mejor manera de obtener dinero era siendo su propio dueño para él y para su familia.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que Fernando está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Fernando podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener algo que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Fernando podrá salir adelante para poder apoyar a su familia y que no les falte nada.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María is 40 years old. She had studied for a technical degree, but did not pursue a career because she married shortly thereafter and her husband did not want her to work. She has two children who still depend on her, and lives in the El Cortijo sector of the Trujillo province.

Luz started in the business of selling juices by traveling throughout the city. Subsequently, with the credit she received from Manuela Ramos, she added a display case in her house for cakes and bread. With both her savings, as well as later loans, she has outfitted her small store. She now has a well-stocked store in her home, and she continues with her sales of juices. She no longer travels around to sell her goods, but is instead able to do so from her own home.

She is a founding member of the collective bank “Luz Divina” (“Divine Light”) where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency). With the loan of 750 soles (approximately $275USD), to be repaid over six months, she will buy sodas, fruit and beer to sell in her store. Given that it is the summer season now, these products are in great demand.

Luz is very happy with what she has achieved, having initially suffered greatly at the hand of her husband. They are now separated, and she feels much better. She dreams of seeing her children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz María tiene 40 años de edad, estudió una carrera técnica pero no la ejerció porque se casó al poco tiempo y su esposo no quería que trabaje. Tiene 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella y vive en el Sector El Cortijo, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. La señora Luz se inicia en el negocio vendiendo jugos en un carrito el cual movilizaba por toda la ciudad, posteriormente con los créditos que recibió de Manuela Ramos puso en su casa un vitrina con algunos pasteles y pan. Ahorrando y con los siguientes créditos ha ido implementando su bodega, ahora tiene una bodega bien surtida en su casa y además no ha dejado el negocio de los jugos, pero ya no vende como ambulante sino en la puerta de su casa. Es socia fundadora del banco comunal “Luz Divina”, en su banco comunal obtuvo un primer crédito de S/. 300 con el cual compró vitrinas para iniciar la implementación de su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/.750, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará gaseosas, fruta y cerveza para vender en su bodega debido a que estamos en temporada de verano y estos productos tienen demanda. La señora Luz está muy contenta con lo que ha logrado, al inicio sufrió mucho porque su esposo la maltrataba pero decidió separarse y se siente mucho mejor. Sueña con ver a sus hijos realizados.

loans.use: Purchase sodas, fruit and beer to sell in general store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel sells soft drinks in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  His stock increased after accessing several small loans from SMT.  Samuel has saved some money from the profit and is requesting a Loan of $350. to purchase re-conditioned used refrigerators for the business.  Samuel is married, 38 years old, and has 2 children.

loans.use: Samuel wants to meet the summer time demand for cold drinks.  He needs the loan to purchase used refrigerators for his business.

loans.name: Mong

texts.en: Mrs. Mong I., 51, lives in Trapeang Chark Village, Kampong Cham province, where she earns $2.50 per day raising pigs and farming. Her husband Thon Tharn, 50, sells wood charcoal and earns $4 per day. They have three children, all of whom work in the garment industry where they each earn $50 per month. Mong I. requests a $500 loan to purchase more pigs to raise as well as buy more land to farm. They hope this loan will increase their business income, which in turn will help support their family.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise as well as buy more land to farm

loans.name: Bugolo Lending Group

texts.en:
Tausi N. is the chairperson of the Bugolo Lending Group in Kikondo, Lugazi. She is 42 years old and married with sx children, and also cares for two more kids. One of the children is an orphan and one is her step-child. They are both in school along with three of her kids.

Tausi's business is buying "mukene" (small silvery fish) from Kikondo to sell in the Tororo district. She's quick to say that the transport costs are worth it because each time she has to move she takes around 80 basins of fish, which she can buy for $400.00 and then sell for $500.00. She can't earn this profit margin if she is stationed at Kikondo in her area. She says the loans have really been helpful because she's been able to stop renting. She would now like a loan to expand her business and buy another plot for farming.

loans.use: Tausi would buy more basins of small fish to sell and buy a plot to farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair an old sewing machine and to purchase cloth and other materials.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok I. is married and lives with her husband in the outskirts of Phnom Penh. She has two children, who are students. Sok and her husband are farmers, normally earning around $4 each day. Recently the weather conditions have not been good, so the family has found it difficult to farm. To improve their standard of living, they plan to take out a loan to raise animals and purchase rice to make rice wine. These two businesses present a good opportunity that will lead to an improvement in their standard of living. Farmers like raising animals because it is easy to get income and spend less. Moreover, rice wine is very popular among Cambodia farmers. They like to drink rice wine because it cheap and not harmful to their health.

loans.use: To raise animals and purchase rice to make rice wine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in bras, shoes, girdles, and other goods to keep running her small business.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mr. Sum S. is a villager in L'vea Sor Kandal Village in Kandal Province. He is a Khmer noodle maker and his wife, Mrs. Chhoem Sophy, is a Khmer noodle seller. Mr. Sum S. now faces a problem because his noodle machine is too old and it cannot make a good Khmer noodles for his customers. Thus, Mr. Sum S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a new Khmer noodle machine for his business. Mr. Sum S. is 54 years old and the father of seven children, two of whom are electricians while two are employed in a garment factory. The remaining three are attending school. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a new Khmer noodle machine for his business.

loans.name: Koffi Etsè Sénamé

texts.fr:
Né le 03 avril 1981 à Sansanné Mango dans la préfecture de l’Oti, Monsieur A. Koffi Etsè Sénamé vit actuellement à Aného où il fait son commerce de quincaillerie. Père de deux enfants, il a une boutique de quincaillerie dénommée Etablissement AVOCH & Fils.

Son emplacement dans la ville fait de lui le plus fréquenté. Avec une clientèle de plus en plus croissante, l’offre diminue par rapport à la demande. 

Pour être la hauteur de la demande et satisfaire sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit pour ravitailler la boutique en quincaillerie.
texts.en:
Born on April 3, 1981 in Sansanné Mango in the Prefecture of Oti, Mr. Koffi Etsè Sénamé A. is presently living in Aného where he has his hardware business. The father of two children, he has a hardware store he calls Etablissement AVOCH & Fils.

His location in the town makes him easy to patronize. With his growing clientele, what he has to sell is gradually diminished by the demand for his goods.

In order to keep up with demand and satisfy the needs of his customers, he is asking for this loan to bolster the inventory of his hardware store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of construction supplies

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: Madame K. Sylvie est née en 1979 à Attiémé. Elle vit actuellement avec ses 2 enfants en charge à Afagnan. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle a vite cerné les rouages de son commerce. Elle achète les produits de première nécessité notamment les savons, les détergeants, du lait et autres à Lomé et les revend à Afagnan. Elle a besoin de financement pour augmenter la taille de son commerce et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie des personnes à sa charge sur le plan scolaire, alimentaire et sanitaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sylvie K. was born in 1979 in Attiémé. She presently lives with her two children in Afagnan. She attended primary school, but quickly stepped out into the business world. She buys staples, especially soap, detergent, milk and other goods, in Lomé and re-sells them in Afagnan.

Sylvie needs a loan to expand the size of her business and better satisfy her clientele. She will use the profit to improve living conditions, from the standpoint of food and health concerns, for the children for whom she is the breadwinner and also to pay school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of staple goods

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 54 años, esta separada D. su pareja, vive con sus hijas, Irma  y Geraldine. Se dedica a la venta D. productos elaborados a base D. quinua, hornea tortas, galletas, etc. pero todo a base D. quinua, este producto andino con muchas propiedades alimenticias. A Juana le gusta hornear estos productos porque sabe que son beneficiosos para los que los consuman, logrando que se sienta muy gratificada con su trabajo. Lo más difícil es el tener que cubrir con la cantidad D. pedidos que le realizan las instituciones, ayudándose muchas veces con sus dos hijas, las cuales la apoyan incondicionalmente. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más quinua para hornear, torteras, moldes, etc para realizar todo tipo D. postres.
texts.en:
Juana is 54 years old, is separated from her partner and lives with her daughters, Irma and Geraldine. She is dedicated to selling products maD. from quinoa, including baked cakes, cookies, etc., but all based on quinoa, an Andean (grain) product with many nutritional benefits. Juana likes to bake these products because she knows that there are benefits for those who eat them, which makes her feel her work is very gratifying. The most difficult thing is to cope with the quantity of orders requested by institutions. Her two daughters help her a lot, supporting it unconditionally. This is her first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the requested money she will buy more quinoa for baking, cakes, molds, etc. to make all kinds of desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and utensils to make her desserts

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta tiene 40 años, es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos, D. los cuales, viven con elL. 2 D. ellos. DesD. muy joven le ha dedicado mucha entrega a sus chacras, por ello no siente dificultad alguna al tener que ir a trabajar en el campo, se levanta a eso D. las 4.00am para preparar los desayunos y el almuerzo D. sus hijos que tiene que ir al colegio, después D. dar alimento a sus vacas, cerca D. las 11.00am, lleva el almuerzo a su esposo en L. chacra. Para esta familia, L. agricultura es su único ingreso económico, a Enriqueta le agrada cultivar sus tierras y cuidar D. su ganado, que a veces le ocasionan problemas por irse a comer los cultivos D. los vecinos. Este es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con L. cantidad solicitada va a comprar abono y veneno para fumigar las hojas para que tengan buen follaje, ya que L. papa depenD. D. L. hoja, para un buen fruto.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is 40 years old, married, with 4 children of whom 2 still live at home. Since she was young she has worked on the farm, and she doesn’t find it difficult to work in the field. She gets up at 4:00 AM to prepare breakfast and lunch for her children who go to school, then she feeds her cows. Around 11:00 AM she takes lunch to her husband on the farm. For this family agriculture is its only source of income. Enriqueta enjoys farming her land. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been punctual in her payments. With the money she is going to buy fertilizer and pesticiD. to fumigate the leaves so that she gets good foliage, as the potato plant depends on its leaf in order to generate good fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Pan Llevar Group

texts.en:
The women of the Triunfadoras de Pan Llevar are requesting a loan of 5,300 Nuevo Soles to fund their various endeavours.  The Triunfadoras (or Triumphant Leaders) are a relatively new bank: they are just completing their first year as a group together.  They meet monthly in the Saenz Peña neighborhood of Pucallpa, Peru – a bustling capital in the eastern jungle region of the country.

Many of the women sell products in the Ollada market in the Saenz Peña neighborhood.  They are requesting loans of individual amounts, but they collectively guarantee the repayment of the entire bulk loan.  The Triumphant Leaders bank members will be using the loan to fund a variety of businesses including: sales of plantains, fruits, bottled drinks, beauty products, food, vegetables and popsicles.  Each woman will repay her portion of the bulk loan within the same four month term.

The twelve bank members pictured are: Angela V. I.(s/.500), Giovana Karina G. G. (s/.500), Noemi V. R.(s/.500), Belen G. L. (s/.500), Luz Angelica C. G. (s/.300) , Patricia Tuanama I. (s/.500), Maria Estrella G. G. (s/.500) , Victoria D. D. (s/.300), Gloris M. P.(s/.500), Antonia C. C.(s/.500), Gina Ysabel C. G. (s/.400), and Sulianita G. G. (s/.300).

loans.use: To purchase supplies of plantains, fruits, bottled drinks, beauty products, food, vegetables and popsicles for resale

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene un pequeño carro de carga donde transporta material de construcción y todo tipo de cargas  dentro la ciudad de El Alto, la esposa es comerciante de verduras, tiene un hijo de 21 años de edad que está estudiando en la universidad estatal. Vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona Villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de motor para su movilidad, para seguir trabajando con su carro que le sirve de herramienta de trabajo.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Marcelino has a small pickup truck with which he transports construction materials and other kinds of cargo. Within the city of El Alto, his wife is a vegetable vendor. He has a son of 21, who is studying in the state university. Marcelino lives in his own house located in the region Villa Tunari in the city of El Alto. This laon will be used to buy a motor for his truck, so that he can continue working with it, because it serves him as a tool for working. This is his second loan with Kiva. He has displayed good payment behavior with our institution, and so he may access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor for his pick up truck to transport construction material and cargo.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Composé de sept femmes(dont trois enseignantes), les membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Lafia sont tous mariés et ont une  moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux dans le village de Tinimbougou dans la préfecture de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des relations amicales. Elles font principalement la vente d’habits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle, elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles veulent acheter avec ce prêt, 40 pièces de six pagnes auprès des fournisseurs de Dioïla pour les revendre en détail  au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Tinimbougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ces femmes espèrent avoir avec ce prêt 7 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune, qu’elles  utiliseront pour l’épanouissement de leur activité.
texts.en:
Composed of seven women (out of which three are teachers), the members of the Benkadi group of the Lafia association are all married and average 26 years of age and 2 children. They live in extended traditional families, with their sisters, brothers, children and husbands, in the village of Tinimbougou in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali. They got acquainted through bonds of friendship, and their businesses mainly consists in selling clothing.

Anxious to better satisfy their customers' needs, they joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy 40 bundles of six pagnes (colorful African cloth) from furnishers in Dioïla, to retail them for cash or on credit in the village of Tinimbougou, to a clientele comprising men and women. These women hope to turn a monthly profit of XOF 7'000 (ca US$ 14) each, to be used to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Nelida I. D. S.  es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe”, del barrio central, en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 64 años D. edad, D. estado civil divorciada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella posee un negocio D. cafetería y Snack en el local municipal del distrito, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra materiales e insumos para su negocio. 
Actualmente requiere un nuevo préstamo, por tanto viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea implementar mejor su negocio D. cafetería y adquirir mas materiales necesarios (tasas, platos, sillas, etc.) asimismo adquirir insumos necesarios (fruta, bebidas, etc.), a fin D. que en el futuro pueda contar con un negocio completo y con gran demanda. 
Ella esta bastante agradecida a Manuela ramos por el apoyo que viene brindando en bien del desarrollo D. las mujeres.
texts.en:
Nelida I. D. S. is a member of Virgen D. Guadalupe Communal Bank, in the central neighborhood of the district Pomata, province Chucuito, departament Puno, Peru; she is sixty four years old, divorced, the mother of five, and has completed primary school. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a feminist organization, for twelve years. She runs her own café and snack bar in her district area. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00, which she used to buy materials and snacks to sell at her café. Now she is requesting a new loan, this time for S/. 800.00, which she will repay in five monthly installments. She will use the loan to better establish her café, and to purchase more necessary materials (cups and plates, chairs, etc.), and important snacks (fruit, drinks, etc.). This will help her to one day have a very strong business and a huge clientele. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for their support and helping women to develop.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To better establish her cafe, and purchase necessary materials: cups and plates, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is 35 years old and married with three children. Victoria sells motor spare parts and is requesting a loan of 100 000 NGN to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Yesi

texts.es: Yesi de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en la casa de sus padres. El labrado de la tierra es parte de su vida, y su única fuente de ingresos, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo. Yesi tiene un bebé al que debe cuidar, por lo que se siente muy triste cuando su hijo llora mientras ella realiza sus tareas en la chacra llevándolo en la espalda, y como madre se siente impotente de no poder brindarle comodidad a su pequeño, ya que si Yesi no trabaja en el campo, su esposo solo, no avanza con las labores.
